Phúc Lợi     Máy tính xách tay   Bảo hiểm   Du Lịch   Phụ cấp   Thưởng   Chăm sóc sức khỏe   Tăng lương   Chế độ nghỉ phép   Chế độ tập thể dục    Mô tả công việc     Phân tích và Báo cáo Kinh doanh:  Thu thập, tổng hợp và phân tích dữ liệu từ các đơn vị kinh doanh Bancassurance.  Xây dựng các báo cáo kinh doanh định kỳ và đột xuất nhằm hỗ trợ Ban Lãnh đạo đưa ra các quyết định chiến lược.  Đánh giá hiệu quả kinh doanh theo các tiêu chí.   Quản lý và Nâng cao Hiệu quả Hoạt động:  Theo dõi hiệu quả của các kênh phân phối Bancassurance, đề xuất các cải tiến để tối ưu hóa hiệu quả hoạt động.  Xây dựng và theo dõi KPIs cho đội ngũ kinh doanh Bancassurance.   Hỗ trợ Chiến lược Kinh doanh:  Đánh giá các xu hướng thị trường và đối thủ cạnh tranh, cung cấp phân tích chi tiết để hỗ trợ hoạch định chiến lược.  Tham gia vào việc xây dựng các kế hoạch kinh doanh dài hạn, trung hạn và ngắn hạn.   Phát triển Hệ thống Báo cáo:  Tự động hóa và chuẩn hóa các hệ thống báo cáo để nâng cao tính chính xác và hiệu quả.  Phối hợp với các phòng ban liên quan để cải tiến hệ thống dữ liệu, đảm bảo việc truy xuất thông tin nhanh chóng và chính xác.    Yêu cầu công việc     Trình độ học vấn:  Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên các ngành: Kinh tế, Tài chính, Ngân hàng hoặc các ngành liên quan.   Kinh nghiệm làm việc:  Tối thiểu 2-3 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực phân tích dữ liệu, báo cáo kinh doanh, hoặc quản lý hiệu quả hoạt động.  Ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm làm việc trong lĩnh vực bảo hiểm, ngân hàng, hoặc mô hình Bancassurance.   Kỹ năng chuyên môn:  Thành thạo Excel, Power BI, SQL và các công cụ phân tích dữ liệu.  Kỹ năng phân tích và trình bày dữ liệu xuất sắc.  Hiểu biết về mô hình Bancassurance và thị trường bảo hiểm nhân thọ tại Việt Nam. ASSIST Vietnam Profile   ASSIST Vietnam is an international NGO, implementing social & environmental projects since 2007. At ASSIST we work closely with corporates/private companies to jointly implement social or environmental projects benefiting the society & environment in Vietnam. We implement projects across many provinces in Vietnam. We have colleagues from different countries working together on project implementation and acquiring new projects. To know more about ASSIST, please visit www.assistasia.org      Position Summary      About the Role  The Group Associate Intern will support the Partnerships & Business Development team with various tasks aimed at providing administrative, research, and logistical assistance. This internship offers an opportunity to learn about market research, partnership development, and business operations while contributing to the team’s success. The intern will gain hands-on experience in data management, research, and event coordination.  Key Responsibilities   Market Research: Assist in gathering information on potential partners and decision-makers using online tools and databases.  Report Preparation: Help consolidate data and assist in preparing regular reports for the team.  Database Support: Assist in maintaining and updating the partnership database with information about partner engagements.  Proposal Assistance: Support the team in preparing materials for partnership proposals and presentations.  Administrative Support: Help schedule meetings, take meeting notes, and assist with team communication tasks.   Secondary & Cross-cutting Responsibilities   Event Support: Attend events and assist in coordinating logistics to help strengthen partnerships.  Team Collaboration: Work with different teams to help organize resources and tools that support business development activities.  General Support: Assist with day-to-day administrative tasks as needed by the team.   Reporting & Coordinating Lines  The Group Associate Intern will report to the designated team lead.   Requirements     Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s program in Business, Marketing, Communications, or a related field.  Good knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) and Google Suite.  Good organizational skills and attention to detail.  Good written and verbal communication skills.  Eagerness to learn and contribute to a professional team environment.  A proactive attitude and willingness to take on tasks as needed.  Interest in business development, partnerships, or market research is a plus.  Ability to work independently with guidance from the team.   Internship period: 3 months   Working place: ASSIST Office Management Room - 390 Hoang Van Thu Street, Ward 4, Tan Binh District, HCMC, Vietnam  Working time: from: 8:00 am to 5:00 pm (flexible depending on activities); from Monday to Friday. Lunch time: 12:00 noon – 1:00 pm  Internship stipend: 4.000.000 VND/ month

Company Description    Bosch first started its operations in Vietnam in 1994 and registered a wholly-owned subsidiary in 2008. According to the business strategy of Bosch in Vietnam, from 1st July 2014 on all business entities were merged into Bosch Vietnam Co. Ltd. with its head office at Ho Chi Minh City plant (HcP) in Dong Nai Province.  HcP has started its belt assembly in a rented building on 1st August 2008 as the assembly plant of Tilburg Plant (TbP). On 14th April 2011, HcP celebrated the inauguration of the new plant (Lth101 with 17,000 sqm), which did not only allow to increase the production depth, but also to facilitate the push belt assembly of this high-tech product. On 3rd July 2012 HcP marked a big milestone by starting to produce the second component (loop-set) for its push belt. Since November 2012, HcP doubled the production floor space and increase the net total floor space up to 56.000 m², and have successfully increased its production capacity and realized a lot of new line SOP’s.  For further information, please visit our website: www.bosch.com.vn       Working location:   No. 8 Street, Tam An, Long Thanh, Dong Nai, Vietnam (Company shuttle service available from various districts of Ho Chi Minh, Bien Hoa, and Binh Duong).       Job Description    Handle daily incoming and outgoing documents that need approvals of management/ authorized signatories in accordance with the company’s regulations and procedures.  Check, review, and manage all documents that need company seal in compliance with the internal and external correspondence policies or Central Directives.  Quarterly coordinate, track, prepare document compliance gratuities reports & charts.  Systematize and archive contracts, agreements, and other important documents according to Data concept & protection. Prepare the annual Long Service awards and thank-you letters and distribute to all respective departments.  Translate documents into Vietnamese or English when required.  Order office stationery for PC, PT, CTG areas on a regular basis.  Other tasks, i.e. admin supports for company events, CSR, internal audit, RB/GF changes, etc. will be assigned depending on her performance.       Qualifications    Education: Last-year students (major in English, Business Administration, Human Resources Management, Foreign Trade and Accounting) can commit to a full-time 6-month internship.  Fluent in both English and Vietnamese writing and speaking skill.  Master of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).  Personality: Careful, Willing to learn, Patient.  Good communication skills.       Additional Information    A learning-driven, professional, inclusive multinational work environment fosters personal growth and expands professional networks.  An attractive monthly allowance.  Bus transportation and lunch are provided daily.  Full-paid leaves for Vietnam public holidays, birthday, sickness and 01 day per working month.  Opportunities to become a Bosch associate after graduation.

Job Title: Assistant, Vietnam Hanoi Office  Corporate Title: Staff  Term: 12 months  Reports to: Country Manager, Vietnam  Location: Hanoi City      ING Bank    ING Bank covers Wholesale and Retail Banking in Asia Pacific. Our Wholesale Banking business is present and active in 11 major economies in the Asia Pacific, namely Australia, China, Hong Kong SAR, India, Indonesia, Japan, Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan and Vietnam.      Job Profile Summary   Support Hanoi Representation Office in overall office operation and business promotion related activities.     ING’s Hanoi Representative Office was established in 2012. The office has liaison function, conducting market surveys, promoting ING’s investment projects in banking operations in Vietnam; accelerating and monitoring execution of contracts, transactions and agreements signed between ING and Vietnamese credit institutions or enterprises, and projects funded by foreign credit institutions or other, interacting closing with all branch staff as well as many offshore stakeholders.      Job Responsibilities:      1) Office Operations   Process payment for Office Expenses.  Support office procurement process such as working on the regular Contracts or Purchase Order with vendors & suppliers on maintenance and service of office facilities.  Work on tasks related to Legal, Compliance, Operation Risk Management (ORM), Information Risk Management (IRM), Finance as instructed by the Office Manager.  Other administrative, logistics arrangement for business trips and client meetings.      2) Business promotion activities   Coordinate with relevant teams to prepare and update Vietnam pitch book.  Collect client’s information and perform pre-credit analysis on clients.  Assist the Chief Representative in business promotion activities.       What we're looking for:    Bachelor’s degree.  Up to 3 years relevant of working experience in Banking & Finance industry, preferably in international banks.  Entrepreneurial with strong multitasking and time-management skills.  Highly reliable and conscientious.  Solid foundation in MS Office products.  Strong communication skills with fluency in English and Vietnamese.  Good ability to network and collaborate with colleagues from different geographies.  Ability to work independently as well as efficiently in a team to be proactive in solving problems.  Self-directed and self-motivated, with positive working attitude and strong teamwork spirit.

I. Mục đích của vị trí    Trợ lý BOD chịu trách nhiệm làm việc và báo cáo trực tiếp cho BOD. Đây là vị trí đóng vai trò hỗ trợ quan trọng trong việc quản lý hoạt động vận hành chung của công ty; thay mặt BOD xử lý các hạng mục công việc trong phạm vi quyền hạn. Vị trí này đòi hỏi kỹ năng tổ chức xuất sắc, sự chú ý đến chi tiết và khả năng quản lý nhiều nhiệm vụ đa dạng trong các phòng ban. Trợ lý BOD sẽ làm việc chặt chẽ với các đơn vị nội bộ và các bên liên quan bên ngoài đảm bảo hoạt động vận hành chung được thuận lợi, kịp thời xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh.       II. Phạm vi trách nhiệm - nhiệm vụ    1. Quản lý vận hành hệ thống kinh doanh của công ty     Kiểm soát hoạt động vận hành và xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh hằng ngày trên hệ thống kinh doanh.     Theo dõi kết quả, lập báo cáo, tổng hợp thông tin theo yêu cầu của BOD.    Đầu mối làm việc với các bên liên quan trong nội bộ công ty về sản xuất kinh doanh.    Thay mặt BOD xử lý các tình huống khẩn cấp khi BOD vắng mặt.     2. Chủ trì xét duyệt kế hoạch, hỗ trợ triển khai các hạng mục công việc phòng Hành chính nhân sự:   Hành chính, Tuyển dụng, Truyền thông nội bộ…    3. Xử lý công việc Hành chính của BOD:   Công tác, thanh toán hóa đơn, chuẩn bị hồ sơ tài liệu, báo cáo…    4. Quản lý quy trình và nguồn lực:     Tham vấn cho BOD các vấn đề về phát triển tổ chức, xây dựng quy chế, quy trình, chính sách nội bộ, điều phối nguồn lực…     Kiểm soát quy trình sản xuất tài nguyên nội bộ.    Quản lý hệ thống tool nội bộ của công ty.     5. Quản lý dự án    6. Các công việc khác theo chỉ đạo của BOD       III. Yêu cầu công việc     Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên các ngành Kinh tế, Tài chính, Marketing, Quản trị kinh doanh, Nhân sự, Luật,… hoặc tương đương.    Có kinh nghiệm từ 1 năm trở lên tại các vị trí Thư ký, Trợ lý, Kiểm soát nội bộ, Vận hành… hoặc tương đương.    Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm MS Office, Google Suite. Có thể sử dụng Google Data Studio, Power BI là 1 điểm cộng.    Ưu tiên: Có kinh nghiệm sử dụng/Sử dụng tốt các công cụ A.I hỗ trợ công việc.    Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt.    Kỹ năng tổng hợp báo cáo, phân tích & đánh giá.    Kỹ năng đàm phán và giải quyết vấn đề.    Khả năng làm việc đa nhiệm, quản lý thời gian, lập kế hoạch tốt.    Tiếng Anh tốt (IELTS 6.5 trở lên hoặc tương đương).    Sẵn sàng làm việc ngoài giờ, đi công tác tần suất thấp.        IV. Quyền lợi     Mức lương khởi điểm: 12.000.000 VNĐ - 18.000.000 VNĐ/tháng.     Phụ cấp ăn trưa: 900.000 VNĐ/tháng.    Review lương 2 lần/năm, thưởng các dịp lễ, Tết,...     Hưởng các quyền lợi theo quy định của Nhà nước (đóng BHYT, BHXH, BHTN). Môi trường làm việc trẻ trung, văn hóa cởi mở, thoải mái, chuyên nghiệp trong công việc.        V. I. MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC     Soạn thảo, xử lý và lưu trữ các văn bản, công văn, báo cáo;  Thực hiện các công tác Hành chính văn phòng: Quản lý điều xe, phòng họp, con dấu, văn bản, công tác tâm linh; Cơm ca, hỗ trợ quản lý nhà ở công vụ;  Trực tiếp quản lý tài sản, thiết bị văn phòng và các tài sản, công cụ dụng cụ, trang thiết bị văn phòng...;  Lập kế hoạch ngân sách, mua sắm; trình/thực hiện thủ tục thanh toán các trang thiết bị, chi phí liên quan đến phòng công vụ, chi phí hoạt động văn phòng Công ty theo quy định;  Hỗ trợ tổ chức và thực hiện công tác hậu cần cho việc tổ chức sự kiện, tiệc, lễ tết,... cho Công ty;  Hỗ trợ công tác tuyển dụng, đào tạo và quản lý nhân sự;  Thực hiện các đầu công việc khác theo sự phân công của cấp trên.     II. Location:  Vietnam  City:  Hanoi  Contract Type:  Staff  Grade:  X4  Salary scale:  Country Scale  Contract Duration:  12 months (possibility of extension)  Deadline:  21/02/2025  Job Reference:  RP25-26   Position Summary   To support program delivery in Vietnam, GGGI is seeking a Program Assistant to execute administrative and project-related tasks. The Program Assistant will play a critical role in ensuring the effective operation of administrative activities, including organizing events, arranging travel, managing supply chain recruitment, procurement, scheduling for the Country Representative, overseeing office assets, and other administrative services. The Program Assistant will work under the supervision of the focal point of the Operations Enabling Division (OED) and the Vietnam Country Representative, supporting Vietnam programs and collaborating with other team members in the Vietnam office.   PURPOSE   The Program Assistant will support the Vietnam Country Office, ensuring smooth daily operations. This role involves managing administrative tasks, organizing schedules, and assisting with relevant operational assignments as needed.   ENGAGEMENT   Under The Guidance Of The Country Representative And OED Focal Point, The Program Assistant Will Perform The Following Tasks Related To GGGI's Country Programs In Vietnam    Administrative Support: Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate travel arrangements for the Country Representative and project teams.  Project Coordination: Assist with ongoing projects, track progress, and follow up on deadlines.     DELIVERY    Administrative Support   Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:    Organize meetings and provide logistical support, including scheduling and documentation.  Monitor and maintain office supplies and assets, ensuring appropriate use and updating inventory and asset records.  Support financial functions, including managing the office budget, expense tracking, and petty cash reconciliation.  Coordinate logistical arrangements for GGGI events and workshops, acting as the main coordinator for event delivery.  Prepare for staff onboarding processes, including visa processing, work permit exemptions, and temporary resident cards for international experts in GGGI Vietnam.     Project Coordination Support     Assist with implementing project procedures and tools to ensure smooth transactions and output delivery.  Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, reports, and meeting notes.     Other Tasks     Perform any additional duties assigned by the Country Representative or Project Manager.     Requirements   QUALIFICATIONS    Undergraduate degree.  At least 1 year of professional experience in administration, logistics, or procurement (preferred).  Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and applications.  Fluent in English and Vietnamese (both written and spoken).  Self-motivated, detail-oriented, with strong organizational skills.    FUNCTIONAL    Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.  Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.  Experience working in an international/multicultural environment.  Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite).  Previous administrative or assistant experience preferred.    CORPORATE    Ability to process and share information effectively and solve problems proactively.  Manage emotions and stress positively, build rapport, and resolve conflicts with ease.  Promote creativity and innovation within the team.  Work effectively with diverse teams, both culturally and professionally.      Child protection – GGGI is committed to child protection, irrespective of whether any specific area of work involves direct contact with children. GGGI’s Child Protection Policy is written in accordance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child.

Company Description    Saigon Social  is a food and drink experience and travel agency in Vietnam, curated by acclaimed food and drink writer  Jovel Chan . From  artisanal fish sauce  to  rice wine  and the country’s  first-of-its-kind Vietnamese craft liquor tasting , Saigon Social goes beyond the usual street food crawl to uncover the craftsmanship, history, and culture behind Vietnam’s most iconic flavours, dishes and ingredients.      Whether you're a curious traveller, a discerning foodie, or a hospitality professional, our one-of-a-kind experiences are designed to be immersive, intimate, and led by passionate tastemakers. This isn’t just a food tour—it’s an invitation to go deep.      Role Description   We’re looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented  Operations Assistant  to help manage the logistics and execution of our food and drink experiences. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves food and culture, and has strong problem-solving skills.     Key Responsibilities     Tour & Experience Coordination:  Assist in scheduling and managing bookings, ensuring smooth execution of experiences.   Guest Communication:  Handle inquiries, confirmations, and special requests before and after tours.   Logistics & Vendor Liaison:  Work with guides, restaurants, bars, and artisans to coordinate schedules and ensure seamless experiences.   On-the-Ground Support:  Be present at key events and tours to assist with setup, guest needs, and troubleshooting.   Admin & Reporting:  Maintain records, manage payments, and track performance metrics for continuous improvement.      Qualifications   Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.  Excellent communication skills in  English and Vietnamese .  Experience in hospitality, tourism, or event coordination is a plus.  Passion for food, drink, and Vietnamese culture.  Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends when needed.      Why Join Us?   Work in a dynamic, fast-growing company at the forefront of Vietnam’s food scene.  Get hands-on experience in curating and executing unique culinary experiences.  Collaborate with top chefs, bartenders, and artisans for one-of-a-kind events       How to Apply:   Send your resume and a short cover letter to jovel@jovelchan.com. Tell us why you’re excited about this role and what makes you a great fit!

Job Number   2025-207   Application Deadline   2/21/2025   Position Start Date   2/24/2025  Position Title Administrative Aide (NY HELPS) Required Application Type School Related Personnel Salary/Pay Scale $38,945 - $44,787 prorated to amount of service Job Description   LOCATION:  Engagement & Development Services – 900 Watervliet-Shaker Road   Basic Function   Works as a staff assistant in performing a variety of routine administrative tasks. Work assignments are received from a superior with major emphasis on providing support services of an administrative and non-defined nature involving the services provided by the agency to the public or to another municipal operating department or agency. Work of a routine nature is performed under general supervision, whereas a new or difficult assignment is performed under direct supervision or with conferences with the agency head or the immediate supervisor. Does related work as required.   Responsibilities     Talks with persons registering complaints regarding the agency’s services, rules and regulations.  Answers routine correspondence on the agency or sections work responsibilities and directs callers to offices where problem may be resolved.  Prepares a variety of routine reports as assigned.  Obtains a variety of information preparatory to the budget, annual reports or similar projects.  Sorts, files and maintains a variety of information for vouchers and purchase orders in alphabetic and/or numeric order.  Operates a computer terminal in maintaining various financial records and reports.  Undertakes special studies as assigned on the agencies implementation of rules, regulations and operating procedures.  Keeps and maintains records and reports.  Good knowledge of office terminology, procedures and equipment.  Good knowledge of business arithmetic and English.  Working knowledge of personnel methods and procedures, organization, reporting and communications.  Working knowledge of statistical techniques, particularly in relation to the collection and tabulation of raw data.  Working knowledge of budget and purchasing procedures.  Ability to layout work for others.  Ability to get along well with subordinates and others and to secure their cooperation.  Ability to properly interpret and make decisions in conference with laws, regulations and policies.  Ability to keep records and to prepare periodic reports on such records.  Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the position.    Civil Service Title Administrative Aide Job Qualifications    A. Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university or one accredited by the New York State Board of Regents to grant degrees with an Associate’s Degree in Secretarial Science, Business, Business Administration, Accounting or related field and one (1) year of clerical experience which involved the operation of a computer for word-processing, database or spreadsheet applications; OR,  B. Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience as defined in (A).     NOTE: Individuals with permanent competitive status as Administrative Aide Trainee mature to Administrative Aide after one year, pending successful completion of probation.   The selected applicant will be subject to a fingerprint supported criminal history background check in accordance with SAVE Legislation effective July 1, 2001.     Candidates will not have to take an exam for this title   . This is a NY HELPS (Hiring Emergency Limited Placement) Program designated title. NY HELPS is a temporary program designed to help local government employers address current staffing issues. Traditionally, the titles filled under the NY HELPS Program required job candidates to compete in a competitive exam to be considered for employment. For the duration of the program, this title will be classified as non-competitive and categorized as a HELPS Program position. At the close of the program, this position will revert to competitive class status. Employees occupying positions filled through the HELPS Program will be granted competitive class status without the need to participate in a competitive exam. Main Responsibilities: - Update Sales Figures, weekly sales performance, monthly Forecast report - Prepare and Present Reports  - Maintain an Accurate Database of Customer and Prospect Information  - Direct feedback from customers to CS  - Track & follow documents procedure between Metrohealth and customer (contract, quotation, PO, debt, rebate annex, delivery note)   - Prepare internal document work: proposal, order request forms, delivery note, Promotion tracking form, document for seminar& group customer, vendor code (create & activate), send sample for testing …  - Handle meetings, seminars….  - Partner with supply chain to keep tracking the goods status   - Calculate Sales incentive (monthly, quarterly..)  - Receiving, processing purchase orders, delivery and payment   - Be responsible for hotel reservation and checking air ticket booking for colleagues' in Business Unit - Follow up the bidding if any  - Ad-hoc tasks       About Zoetis       At   Zoetis  , our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.        Diversity, Equity & Inclusion       Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities  , and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.     Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more    here   . Tuyển dụng  Nhân viên Hành chính - Lễ tân  Ứng tuyển   TIÊU CHUẨN YÊU CẦU     Nữ, ngoại hình ưa nhìn, gương mặt tươi tắn;  Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng trở lên các chuyên ngành: Quản trị nguồn nhân lực, Quản trị kinh doanh, Kinh tế, Xã hội,...;  Tác phong nhanh nhẹn, nhiệt tình, tự tin;  Khả năng giao tiếp tốt và có thể giao tiếp bằng tiếng Anh lưu loát;  Thành thạo tin học văn phòng đặc biệt kỹ năng soạn thảo văn bản     YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC     Trực quầy lễ tân và đón tiếp, hướng dẫn khách hàng/đối tác/nhà cung cấp và ứng viên đến phỏng vấn tại tòa nhà;  Trực tổng đài điện thoại, tiếp nhận điện thoại gọi đến và kết nối đến phòng ban liên quan;  Quản lý, điều phối và chuẩn bị phòng họp theo yêu cầu.  Tiếp nhận, kiểm soát và xử lý thư từ, công văn, bưu kiện gửi đến và gửi đi;  Theo dõi đăng ký suất cơm và thực hiện thanh toán chi phí cho nhà cung cấp;  Theo dõi và thanh toán các chi phí văn phòng định kỳ: điện, nước, internet,...  Tham gia tổ chức các sự kiện của công ty.     QUYỀN LỢI     Thu nhập cạnh tranh (thỏa thuận theo năng lực);  Phụ cấp tiền cơm 30.000 đ / ngày + đài thọ miễn phí cơm trưa;  Tham gia đầy đủ BHXH theo quy định, gia tăng bảo hiểm sức khỏe;  Thưởng Lễ Tết, thưởng hiệu quả kinh doanh cuối năm (từ 1 – 3 tháng lương tùy vào hoạt động kinh doanh công ty trong năm), lương thâm niên, ...;  Được trang bị phòng tập gym, yoga hiện đại, cùng thiết bị hỗ trợ công tác tân tiến, xe đưa rước công tác, ...;  Tham gia các chương trình đào tạo công ty tổ chức để nâng cao kỹ năng & nghiệp vụ.  Làm việc tại Thuận Hải – công ty cung cấp giải pháp năng lượng hàng đầu Việt Nam (khối tư nhân), môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp cùng rất nhiều tiện ích;     THÔNG TIN KHÁC   Hồ sơ ứng tuyển gửi về email: tuyendung@thuanhai.com.vn

Job Purpose   We are seeking a proactive Temporary Change Management Specialist to join our IT Division for an 8-month period. The ideal candidate will have strong writing skills, coordination and reporting abilities, and good design skills. This role is crucial in supporting the division's transformation from processes to culture by organizing events, crafting internal communications, designing newsletters, and generating necessary reports.   Key Accountabilities (1)     Support Change Initiatives: Assist in driving change within the IT Division by organizing division-wide events, activities, and trainings.    Internal Communication: Write clear and concise internal communications to effectively convey directives and announcements across the division.    Design Work: Create visually appealing newsletters and other communication materials using Canva and PowerPoint.    Reporting: Generate and analyze reports to track progress and impact of change initiatives.    Event Coordination: Plan and execute events that promote cultural and process changes within the division.      Key Relationships - External Stakeholders  Partners providing professional services   Success Profile - Qualification and Experiences     Hold a Bachelor's degree in Business, HR, Communication, Marketing, or other related field.    1-2 years experience in change management, internal communication, event organization, or HR culture roles.    Proficiency in design tools such as Canva and PowerPoint.    Coordination and organizational skills.    Reporting and analytical skills.    Strong writing and communication abilities.    Ability to work proactively and in a dynamic team.

Responsibilities:   To ensure that the highest standards of service are maintained through proactive and competent administrative support and planning processes within the Client Rooms   Core Responsibilities     Reception Desks within opening hours; work flexibly to ensure coverage of these – and to adhere to the opening and closing procedures.   Review reservations as they are created by our employees  Provide guidance and reserve spaces as needed for large meetings Assist clients with meeting and help serve beverages as needed  Liaise with external vendor if catering is required in meeting rooms Review AV requirements with internal client and Audio Visual Technician Registered all visiting clients in EMS (Event Management System)  To give accurate and appropriate information at all times, seeking specialist support where necessary. Review details of each allocated meeting for the coming day.      Business Results   Confirmed meetings where required to maintain close contact with bookers to identify clients’ needs. Ensure core brand standards are delivered across all business areas. To liaise with the on-site facilities team to ensure that a proactive schedule of maintenance, painting, French polishing and cleaning is in place on a quarterly basis.   Client / Customer Focus   Meet and greet each relevant client of the facility on a daily basis to provide a personalized service and to assure quality service. Ensure client needs are identified and all details communicated (including changes, additions or deletions) of each program/meeting to all members of our partners and external vendor teams to ensure a seamless delivery of service excellence. Serve as the primary liaison between the internal client and relevant partners. Handle registration of all visitors to the Client Rooms   Teamwork/Leadership   To assist ongoing administration tasks. Printing daily reports, updates for all meeting held in Client Rooms and making certain changes are updated and communicated accordingly. To maintain a positive and professional poise throughout all business dealings. To present a polished image, following uniform guidelines without exception. To support the operation of the Client Rooms To support local management on some other ad-hoc Branch-wise tasks   Risks & Controls   Use EMS as the singular booking tool for all Client Rooms related activity. Track accuracy of EMS data entry for reporting and compliance purposes through verification and cross checking processes. To ensure that the Reception Desks remain tidy, organised and ready for business. To ensure that all areas, including the reception, corridors and washrooms are presentable at all times. To ensure that the client rooms are checked for cleanliness, correct layout and catering requirements and AV provision are ready and available at the requested time by liaising with our vendor partners. Demonstrate cost control and correct allocation of charges per cost centre according to usage for all locations.   Personal Profile     Customer-facing experience  Experience within an event-centric team  Track record of quality service provision  Strong interpersonal skills  Highly organized; ability to handle multiple tasks and apply judgment to prioritize  Strong Computer Skills, (MS Office; Room Booking System e.g. EMS)  Flexibility to deal with a fast-paced, diverse environment  Excellent communication skills; both oral and written  Team player  Work comfortably under pressure and observe deadlines  Highly motivated

Locates and attaches appropriate file correspondence to be answered by Executive Chef.  Types, files, and upkeeps all private and confidential matters related to the department.  Sets up a systematic and efficient filing system, both for hardcopies as well as all electronic data, that enables quick retrieval; ensures all files are kept up-to-date at all times. Qualifications   Minimum requirements  3 years of experience in the same position  Pre-opening experience is preferable  Luxury background in resort and urban city  Excellent communication skills in both spoken and written English

LMSL,  Life Management Science Labs  (https://lifemanagementsciencelabs.com/), was established as a companion to people everywhere, supporting them with products and services in understanding and managing their lives better. At the core of what we do is the combination of scientific research and practical insights, appreciation for aesthetics, community and happiness. By embarking on this new life journey with us, either individually, as a couple, family or through a company, you will be joining our thriving community on a path to improved wellbeing, enabled by a better version of self, day by day.  LMSL has recently started localization projects in Vietnam, Indonesia and Romania, we’re on a mission of expanding our products and services to more people, empowering their changes in life. To help people with more diversified and comprehensive solutions, we are looking for an Admin & Production Assistant to help us in the production of our podcast, street interviews, courses, and other media projects.   Your Main Responsibilities Include     Assist the team with scheduling and guest booking for our podcast show;  Provide administrative support and file management using Asana and Google Drive;  Help manage various paperwork for the team;  Develop and maintain a filing system for the documents of the team;  Perform regular quality checks of the files including digital material to ensure that they are updated, complete and free of errors;  Assist in communication with external partners  Prepare regular reports for the team including filming session report, task norming, and ROI report, etc;  Provide general assistance during filming sessions;  Other duties as they arise according to direct manager requests;     We Expect You To     Hold a university degree, preferably in Project Management, or other relevant fields;  1-2 years' experience in an admin role or similar function  Adept in using Ms Office suite, project tracking tools, and communication tools  Strong organization and detail orientation skills  Good communication both among internal and external stakeholders  Have excellent verbal and written communication and active listening skills;  Excellent communication and collaboration skills;  Be able to work independently, but also as part of a team;  Great critical thinking, problem-solving, and time management skills;  Excel in written and spoken English and Vietnamese     Some Business Facts About The KPI Institute     20 years spent on researching KPI best practice;  220+ research reports published to date;  6 continents on which we deliver trainings;  42 global partner organizations;  78 countries where we delivered educational programs.     Some Friendly Facts About The KPI Institute     Young and enthusiastic working environment;  A work environment that rewards innovative ideas;  Flexible working hours;      Application Info Required     CV;  Cover letter.      Contract/Engagement type:  Independent Contractor   Starting date:  To be discussed after an interview   Duration:  Undetermined period, with 3 months’ probation period   No. of hours:  Up to 40h/week   Working schedule:  During office hours: 09:00-18:00   Location:  Hybrid (HCMC Distric 2)

Position Overview   As a Due Diligence Analyst, you are expected to provide support through data analysis, investigation, research and interpretation. You are expected to provide Due Diligence services by following strict rules, policies and instructions set by the client in compliance with KYC, AML Regulations, Counter-Terrorist Financing regulations, Sanctions Regulations, and Customer Due Diligence policies. You will be responsible for managing the onboarding process for new merchants or individuals, ensuring that all required documentation is collected, reviewed, and client concerns are addressed. You are also expected to contribute to the overall performance of the team by providing accurate, concise and timely reports, direct client support, and hands-on execution of these tasks. You are expected to assist the Specialist in resolving complex cases appropriate to the account assigned and deliver accurate advisement to your client, internal or external.   WHAT WILL YOU DO?    Due Diligence Support     Handles due diligence cases from Payreto Clients  Handles Know Your Customer (KYC) / Know Your Business (KYB) processes as part of the Onboarding as a Service processes.  Attends Client Inquiries in a timely manner.  Updates process guides as coordinated with the team.  Extends support to the due diligence processes of clients outsourced to Payreto.  Identifies, resolves and/or communicates issues related to applications and/or miscellaneous documentation in a timely fashion.  Performs necessary checks and identifies any potential risk / issues clients might face.     Know-Your-Customer (KYC) Checks     Carries out background checks: collecting and monitoring all relevant documents concerning the identity of the customer, as well as gaining insight into their business, ownership structure, and financial transactions for customer onboarding.  Assesses completeness and document quality prior to ensure that the documents are correct and are up to date to the commencement of the business relationship  Performs required checks (Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) and Sanctions/Adverse Media hits on individuals and entities)  Accesses public information sources such as income and asset declarations to assess the risk level of the customer to help develop a higher level of identity assurance  Verifies if there are changes in the customer’s ownership, products and services, or the business that merits     Client / Customer Engagement     Engages the client or the clients’ representative (e.g. account manager, operation specialist, process managers, etc.) to provide feedback, support, and or implementation of services outsourced to Payreto.  Participates in the clients’ internal account management calls and meetings to provide an overview of the status of processes outsourced to Payreto.  Proactively engages the client and/or client customers to provide the best customer experience possible.     Reports Generation     Generates Leadership Report ensuring proper documentation of the meetings with client, internal team updates, workload projection, and any other significant updates.  Ensures an accurate and on time delivery of offered solutions to assigned clients based on their needs.  Ensures accurate reporting of activities, opportunities, and/or challenges to the account manager assigned.     Other Tasks     Performs other official work as instructed by the immediate supervisor/manager.  Recommends and proactively implements opportunities for increased departmental efficiency.  Extends work hours when needed.  Maintains quality service by monitoring standards and/or advising Account Managers and Team leads of potential problems.     WHAT SHOULD YOU HAVE?     Bachelor's degree in Law, Business administration, Accounting, Finance or other related field.  Above average English verbal and written communication skills.  Well - versed with different Microsoft Office Tools or equivalent Google Suite tools, specifically Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets.  Must be adept in using online search engines to find relevant information.  Must have average logical and verbal reasoning.  Ability to provide correct decisions based on rules and policies.  Detail-oriented and must have strong cognitive, comprehension, and strong analytical skills.  Self-starter, driven, eager to learn and is able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.  Demonstrates ownership and accountability (can be seen by others as reliable).  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  Ability to work well under pressure with a high degree of accuracy.  Has initiative and must be flexible to adjust to the work environment and business needs.     Shift Schedule     2:00 PM - 11:00 PM (GMT +7)

Date: 16 Feb 2025  Type of Employment: Permanent Full Time  Location:  Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, VN Hanoi, Hanoi, VN   Title:  SR&T – Analyst (Fresh Graduates)   Are you ready to unleash your potential?   At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.  We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.  Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.  We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.  Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!   Work you’ll do     Actively participate and work with the team in client engagements.  Review financial documents and analyze financial data.  Prepare presentations and reports.  Contribute to the development of client proposals and business development activities.  Perform administrative tasks as needed to support project teams.     Your role as a leader   At Deloitte, We Believe In The Importance Of Empowering Our People To Be Leaders At All Levels. We Connect Our Purpose And Shared Values To Identify Issues As Well As To Make An Impact That Matters To Our Clients, People And The Communities. Additionally,Analystsacross Our Firm Are Expected To    Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development.  Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and business.  Understand the set expectations and demonstrate accountability in keeping personal performance on track.  Actively focus on developing effective communications and relationship-building skills with stakeholders, clients and team.  Demonstrate an appreciation for working with others.  Understand what is fundamental to Deloitte’s success as a business.  Demonstrate integrity and an awareness of strengths, differences, and personal impact.  Develop their understanding of Deloitte and offer a fresh perspective.     Requirements     Fresh graduates with a degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Management, Risk Management, or a related field.  Strong academic record.  Prior internship experience or coursework in audit, business strategy, finance, risk management, or related areas is a plus.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorized Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.   Requisition ID: 106706  In Vietnam, the services are provided by Deloitte Vietnam Company Limited and other related entities in Vietnam ("Deloitte in Vietnam"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Vietnam, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.

Position Summary      Support internal management decision-making by producing business performance analysis which is identified, measured and delivered economic information of business activities by accounting method.   Establish management and execution plans and conduct financial supports such as managing actual implementation of plans to maximize business performance.   Optimize and efficiently manage internal policy & procedure based on business accounting standards and business circumstance.      Role And Responsibilities      [Controlling] Participate in and make a regular report on management activity plans (sales, manufacturing, marketing, development) and performances every month or a report for each management issue frequently..   [CO Closing] Participate in analyzing profits and providing a production cost management model, calculating production costs by product and model or unit project like sales and development.   [Budget & Investment Control] Participate in establishing and managing a budget plan for our company's available resources like expense and investment.   [Policy & Procedure Management] Participate in managing and maintaining internal policies and processes according to corporate accounting standards and management condition.      Skills And Qualifications      Develops professional expertise by complying with company policies and procedures   Works on problems of moderate scope where analyzing situations or data requires a review on various factors   Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action   Normally receives general instructions on routine work with detailed instructions on new projects or assignments   Generally requires a bachelor's degree with a minimum 2 years related experience   Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. Company Description    HD Capital Fund Management Joint Stock Company  is an experienced firm in fund management and financial investment in Vietnam. With strategic partnerships and a focus on growth and collaboration in the Vietnam market, we offer a dynamic business landscape for professionals to thrive.     Growing intensively in Vietnam, we are looking for a:      Investment Analyst.      The selected person will report directly to the General Manager and is responsible for daily tasks related to Investments and Portfolio Management.     His/Her main responsibilities will be:   Responsible for managing the company's investment and securities trading activities, including stocks, bonds, fund certificates, private equity investments, and other financial instruments.  Develop investment strategies, policies, and securities investment operational plans.  Conduct research and propose investment portfolios for the company.  Based on potential securities portfolio proposals, prepare investment recommendation reports for the company.  Participate in all aspects of launching new funds and managing upcoming funds, including bonds and equities.  Perform other tasks as assigned by the Board of Directors. Do you possess solid knowledge of alternative investments or just enthusiasm for a leading private equity and private credit consultancy firm? Consider joining  Renn Global Management LLC  based out of the USA. We are a global alternative investment manager building a next-generation asset management firm focused on the technology venture ecosystem. We provide capital solutions across venture capital, private credit and private equity asset classes. Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and expertise, we stand at the forefront of the industry, pioneering cutting-edge solutions that redefine traditional investment paradigms. We are transforming the landscape of asset management, propelled by a passionate commitment to shaping the future of finance.  As a Deal Sourcing Investment Associate on our fund syndication platform, you'll identify and evaluate private credit investment opportunities, managing the outbound campaign and deal pipeline effectively. This role blends the art of sales with the science of finance, offering a unique opportunity to drive our outreach and qualification processes. You'll leverage both independent research and the extensive resources of our team to uncover and initiate engagements with businesses that align with our strategic goals. With your analytical skills and financial acumen, you'll navigate market complexities, contributing to the growth of diverse investment portfolios.   Are you ready to elevate your value to new heights and redefine the future? Start your journey with team Renn today.    IN DETAIL, YOUR SUCCESS IN THIS JOB WILL BE     Effectively utilize both proprietary and external research tools to systematically identify and assess potential investment opportunities. Focus on uncovering hidden gems within the private credit and broader financial markets. Leverage your exceptional networking skills, industry events, and thorough market research to scout for the most promising opportunities;  Embark on detailed due diligence expeditions, meticulously dissecting financial statements and market trends to navigate the complex landscape of risk and opportunity with unparalleled precision across private credit markets;  Craft persuasive investment memos, masterfully weaving together market analysis and financial projections into narratives that champion our investment theses, targeting credit facilities for growth;  Disseminate compelling materials that communicate our value proposition. Initiate and manage outreach campaigns, setting up introductory calls to explore potential alignments;  Conduct preliminary assessments through video calls and networking, efficiently qualifying opportunities based on their fit with our investment criteria;  Collaborate closely with the product development team to significantly enhance platform functionality and user experience, driving innovation with your insightful and constructive feedback;  Work in perfect harmony with Investment Managers and Stakeholders, fostering effective communication and strategic alignment for our collective success in diverse investment environments;  Vigilantly monitor and support our portfolio companies, guiding them through performance tracking, strategic reviews, and milestone achievements towards sustained growth and unparalleled success, appreciating the unique dynamics of credit investments;  Continuously keep your finger on the pulse of industry trends and emerging technologies, fueling our strategies with your innovative and forward-thinking insights, ensuring we remain at the forefront of private credit markets.     What You’ll Need For Success In This Job     Hold a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Banking or a closely related field. Possession of an MBA or a relevant advanced degree will be considered an advantageous asset;  Bring at least one year of professional experience in venture capital, growth equity, investment banking, or similar fields, underscored by a profound understanding of investment methodologies and deal flow dynamics. The designated title will be assigned per your strength and experience;  Demonstrate exceptional analytical prowess, capable of executing in-depth financial analyses, market research, and comprehensive due diligence;  Exhibit outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, proven through the crafting of insightful materials and effective conversations;  Be meticulously detail-oriented, with a steadfast commitment to precision, and adept at juggling various tasks and projects without compromising quality;  Show proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis tools, and the Google Suite, enabling sophisticated analysis and efficient operation;  Embody the spirit of a self-starter with a proactive approach, continuously seeking and capitalizing on new investment opportunities with vigor;  Harbor a passionate interest in startups, technology, and innovation, coupled with a keen desire to actively contribute to the development and success of early-stage companies.     PIONEERING THE FUTURE OF INVESTMENT WITH RENN    Renn Global Management LLC  is a global alternative investment manager building a next-generation asset management firm focused on the technology venture ecosystem. We provide capital solutions across venture capital, private credit, and web3/digital asset classes. Renn Global has developed a proprietary syndication platform and investment approach that represents the future of asset management.   OUR EXPERTISE    Artificial Intelligence   From machine learning to natural language processing, we create intelligent systems that adapt, learn, and evolve.   Finance   We design and develop next-gen financial solutions, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in digital banking, fintech, and beyond.   E-commerce   Reinventing the way we buy, sell, and exchange goods online, our e-commerce solutions are designed to deliver unparalleled user experiences and create thriving digital marketplaces.  Team Renn is a staunch advocate for equal employment opportunities. We embrace and encourage applicants from all backgrounds for every position, without considering race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any physical or mental disability. We are dedicated to fostering a vibrant work culture that upholds diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, a strong customer focus, and a commitment to innovation.

Execute research initiatives    INCO: “Cushman & Wakefield”

Tham gia cùng Terraverde Travel & Events – Chúng tôi đang tuyển dụng!    Vị trí:   • Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay  (Ticketing Officer)   • Kế Toán Viên (Accountant)   Địa điểm làm việc:  Sala Urban Area, An Lợi Đông Ward, Thành phố Thủ Đức, TP. Hồ Chí Minh  Terraverde Travel, một thương hiệu hàng đầu trong lĩnh vực du lịch và lữ hành, đang tìm kiếm những ứng viên tài năng, cẩn thận và có tinh thần trách nhiệm cao để gia nhập đội ngũ của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi đang tuyển dụng Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay và Kế toán viên, những người đam mê lĩnh vực dịch vụ, tài chính và kế toán, đồng thời mong muốn đóng góp vào sự thành công của một công ty năng động. Nếu bạn có sự chú ý đến từng chi tiết và sẵn sàng nâng tầm sự nghiệp của mình, chúng tôi muốn lắng nghe từ bạn.      1. Vị trí:  Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay   Mô tả công việc:    Đặt vé máy bay theo yêu cầu của khách hàng.  Kiểm tra giá vé, điều kiện vé và thực hiện xuất/hủy/hoàn đổi vé.  Hỗ trợ tư vấn các phương án tối ưu về giá và lịch trình bay cho khách hàng.  Theo dõi và cập nhật các chính sách, quy định của hãng hàng không.  Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để đảm bảo dịch vụ tốt nhất cho khách hàng.  Xử lý các tình huống phát sinh liên quan đến vé máy bay.    Yêu cầu:    Có ít nhất 1 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực đặt vé máy bay.  Thành thạo các hệ thống đặt vé của hãng hàng không (Amadeus, Galileo, Sabre…) là 1 lợi thế. Công ty sẽ đào tạo khi cần thiết.  Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt, cẩn thận, tỉ mỉ và có tinh thần trách nhiệm cao.  Khả năng làm việc độc lập và phối hợp nhóm tốt.  Tiếng Anh đọc hiểu tốt       2. Vị trí:  Kế Toán Viên   Mô tả công việc:    Tiếp nhận, kiểm tra và xử lý các chứng từ thu – chi.  Thực hiện thu tiền từ khách hàng và nhập liệu vào hệ thống phần mềm kế toán.  Theo dõi công nợ khách hàng, nhắc nợ và đối chiếu công nợ định kỳ.  Hạch toán các nghiệp vụ kế toán liên quan đến thu – chi theo đúng quy định.  Đảm bảo số liệu kế toán chính xác, đầy đủ và kịp thời.  Hỗ trợ lập báo cáo thu – chi hàng ngày, hàng tuần và hàng tháng.  Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để đảm bảo quy trình thanh toán được thực hiện nhanh chóng và chính xác.  Lưu trữ, sắp xếp chứng từ kế toán một cách khoa học, dễ tra cứu.    Yêu cầu:    Tốt nghiệp chuyên ngành Kế toán, Tài chính hoặc các ngành liên quan.  Có từ 01 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí kế toán thu hoặc kế toán thanh toán.  Thành thạo phần mềm kế toán MISA AMIS và Microsoft Office (đặc biệt là Excel).  Cẩn thận, trung thực, có trách nhiệm với công việc.  Kỹ năng làm việc nhóm và giao tiếp tốt.  Có khả năng làm việc độc lập, chịu được áp lực công việc.  Tiếng Anh đọc hiểu tốt         3. Quyền lợi:    Mức lương thỏa thuận theo năng lực  Được hưởng đầy đủ chế độ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN theo quy định của pháp luật.  Thưởng theo hiệu quả công việc và các ngày lễ, tết.  Cơ hội phát triển nghề nghiệp trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp.  Được đào tạo nâng cao nghiệp vụ      📩  Cách ứng tuyển:   Vui lòng gửi CV về email: recruit@terraverde.travel với tiêu đề  "Ứng tuyển - [Tên vị trí]" .  Hạn nộp hồ sơ: 21 / 02 / 2025  Cảm ơn và mong được chào đón bạn gia nhập đội ngũ Terraverde Travel!

thyssenkrupp Polysius Vietnam (tkPV) is a wholly owned subsidiary company of thyssenkrupp Polysius GmbH, the world leader in Cement Technology. tkPV specializes in the design, supply, and installation of cement plant machines out of Vietnam to support cement manufacturers in the SEA region with a product and service portfolio, which is based on more than 160 years of expertise and experience. tkPV also boasts of a team of highly skilled design experts, who provide services for global projects of thyssenkrupp Polysius Germany from Vietnam. Our plants and machines use state-of-the-art production processes, conserve resources, minimize environmental impact, and meet the requirements for productivity, energy and heat efficiency. Thyssenkrupp Polysius is a world leader in developing solutions for the world in its march towards green technology in the Cement industry.     General Responsibilities  Responsible for ensuring the accuracy and completeness of invoices received from vendors and suppliers. This role involves verifying invoices for missing information, validating the details, and processing the invoices in the system.     Main Tasks  · Invoice verification & processing:  · Verify each invoice to ensure the accuracy and completeness of all required elements, such as vendor details, tax rate, invoice number, etc.  · Post the invoices to the system in line with Company guidelines.  · Actively follow up unresolved cases and timely report to team leader regarding open points in invoice processing workflow.  · Stay updated with any changes in accounting regulations and industry best practices related to invoice processing.     Experience   ·  Diploma in Finance & Accounting  · Fresh graduate or 1-year experience in invoice processing or accounts payable operations.   · Basic understanding of accounting principles/financial reporting/commercial knowledge   · Ability in using accounting software and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems is an advantage.     Competencies   ·  Basic English skills  · Strong attention to detail and analytical skills to identify and resolve discrepancies.  · Excellent organizational and time management skills to manage a high volume of invoices.  · Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.

JOB DESCRIPTION  Tham gia trực tiếp vào các nhóm tư vấn kế toán cho khách hàng, chịu trách nhiệm thực hiện các công việc cụ thể bao gồm nhưng không giới hạn các công việc sau:     • Ghi sổ kế toán:  - Tiếp nhận và kiểm tra các hồ sơ chứng từ liên quan do khách hàng gửi đến;  - Lập báo cáo thuế như Tờ khai thuế GTGT, thuế TNCN, thuế TNDN, thuế nhà thầu nước ngoài và các loại thuế khác (nếu có);  - Xử lý nghiệp vụ kế toán, cập nhật vào phần mềm kế toán;  - Chuẩn bị đầy đủ tài liệu, hồ sơ cho Báo cáo tài chính đã hoàn thành của từng khách hàng;  - Lập Báo cáo tư vấn hàng tháng, chuyển cho các cấp quản lý kiểm tra, rà soát lại trước khi chuyển cho bộ phận dịch sang tiếng Nhật và gửi cho khách hàng;  - In sổ sách kế toán khi được yêu cầu;  - Phối hợp với đơn vị kiểm toán của khách hàng khi kiểm toán Báo cáo tài chính năm.     • Rà soát số liệu kế toán:  - Tham gia công tác rà soát số liệu kế toán cũng như Báo cáo tài chính hàng tháng, hàng quý tại văn phòng, nhà máy của các khách hàng;  - Lập Báo cáo tư vấn trong đó nêu rõ các vấn đề tồn tại, ảnh hưởng của những vấn đề này đến số liệu kế toán và đưa ra các khuyến nghị cũng như các bút toán điều chỉnh cần thiết cho khách hàng;  - Phối hợp với đơn vị kiểm toán của khách hàng khi kiểm toán Báo cáo tài chính năm (nếu cần thiết).     • Các công việc khác:  - Chuẩn bị hồ sơ hoàn thuế GTGT cho các khách hàng có yêu cầu; Tham gia việc soát xét hóa đơn, hồ sơ chứng từ kế toán cũng như các tài liệu khác liên quan đến việc hoàn thuế GTGT;  - Tham gia việc soát xét hóa đơn, hồ sơ chứng từ kế toán cũng như các tài liệu khác liên quan đến việc quyết toán thuế TNDN năm;  - Các công việc phát sinh thêm khác theo yêu cầu của khách hàng và công ty...  - Chi tiết công việc sẽ trao đổi thêm trong quá trình phỏng vấn.     JOB REQUIREMENTS  • Tốt nghiệp các trường đại học khối kinh tế, tài chính – chuyên ngành kế toán/kiểm toán,   • 1 nhân viên với kinh nghiệm về tư vấn kế toán: trên 1 năm với vị trí Junior Accounting Consultant   • 1 nhân viên với kinh nghiệm về tư vấn kế toán: trên 4 năm với vị trí Senior Accounting Consultant  • Ưu tiên các ứng viên đã làm việc cho các công ty FDI (đặc biệt là Công ty Nhật Bản) các công ty dịch vụ kế toán  • Sử dụng tiếng Anh cơ bản và vi tính thành thạo (Word, Excel,...),  • Năng động, cầu tiến, chăm chỉ, có khả năng chịu được áp lực công việc, có khả năng làm việc chính xác và cẩn thận,  • Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt,  • Có khả năng làm việc nhóm và làm việc độc lập.     QUYỀN LỢI:  - Đóng bảo hiểm bắt buộc theo quy định của Luật Lao động;  - Bảo hiểm tai nạn và sức khỏe 24/24: sau khi NLĐ hoàn thành hợp đồng chính thức 12 tháng.  - Nghỉ phép năm: 12 ngày. Cộng thêm 1 ngày nghỉ phép dành cho gia đình (tổng cộng 13 ngày nghỉ phép) sau khi hoàn thành hợp đồng chính thức 12 tháng.  - Review lương: 1 lần 1 năm  - Tiền thưởng: do HĐQT quyết định dựa trên kết quả kinh doanh của công ty và hiệu quả công việc của nhân viên.  - Khám sức khoẻ định kỳ: 1 lần 1 năm  - Trường hợp cha mẹ, vợ/chồng, con mắc bệnh hiểm nghèo (theo Danh sách do Sở Y tế ban hành), công ty sẽ hỗ trợ 10tr đ/trường hợp  - Du lịch công ty, teambuilding: 1 lần 1 năm.  - Tham gia các bữa tiệc, sự kiện của công ty…  - Cơ hội thăng tiến nghề nghiệp.  - Đào tạo liên tục và phát triển chuyên môn.  - Thời gian làm việc: Từ Thứ 2 – Thứ 6, 8:30 – 17:30  Địa điểm làm việc:  Chi nhánh Công ty Cổ phần Fair Consulting Việt Nam tại TP.HCM  Phòng 7, Riverbank Place, 3c Tôn Đức Thắng, Quận 1, TP.HCM.

Mô tả công việc  Tính toán và xử lý tiền lương hàng tháng cho nhân viên, đảm bảo chính xác và kịp thời. Hiểu biết về luật thuế, BHXH và các quy định liên quan.  Kỹ năng phân tích và xử lý số liệu tốt.  Kỹ năng giao tiếp và giải quyết vấn đề hiệu quả.  Chú ý đến chi tiết và khả năng làm việc dưới áp lực.     Quyền lợi  Lương cứng từ VND 14.000.000 - 25.000.000 gross/tháng  Phụ cấp ăn trưa  12 ngày phép năm, lương tháng thứ 13, Du lịch hàng năm  Review công việc theo yêu cầu  Bảo hiểm, thuế TNCN theo quy định nhà nước     Địa điểm làm việc - Hồ Chí Minh: 38 đường B4, Khu đô thị Sala, Phường An Lợi Đông, Quận 2 Thời gian làm việc Thứ 2 - Thứ 6 (từ 09:00 đến 17:00)

Responsibilities   Document and Payment Verification   Receive and review payment documents from relevant departments.  Verify the legality of invoices and ensure payment documents comply with company policies, including forms, budgets, and approvals.   Transaction Recording and Data Entry   Issue receipts, payment vouchers, and sales invoices for transactions as they occur.  Enter data into the accounting software for accounts related to cash, accounts payable and receivable, inventory, revenue, expenses, etc., ensuring timely recording within the correct period.   Accounts Payable and Receivable Management   Monitor internal and external accounts payable and receivable with customers and suppliers.  Prepare monthly or on-request reports, conducting monthly, quarterly, and annual reconciliations.   Tax Filing and Reporting   Prepare and submit VAT, PIT, CIT declarations, usage reports, and other applicable tax filings.  Ensure timely submission of all tax declarations and reports as required by law.   Expense Allocation   Allocate prepaid expenses, tools, equipment, and fixed assets according to accounting standards.   Document Review and Reconciliation   Review and verify all supporting documents and invoices to ensure accuracy in tax declarations.  Reconcile detailed and summary accounts to ensure accuracy and compliance.   Profit and Loss Transfer   Perform carry-forward entries of unallocated profits from the previous year.  Record current year profit and loss to accurately reflect the financial position.   Financial Reporting   Prepare financial statements, including the balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement, and financial report notes.   Annual Licensing and Tax Submission   Submit annual business license tax filings by the 31st of January each year.  Submit financial statements and tax documents in compliance with current legal regulations.        Qualifications    Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.  2+ years of experience in general accounting, with a strong understanding of tax filing and financial reporting.  Strong knowledge of accounting principles, local tax laws, and financial regulations.  Proficiency in accounting software and ERP, Quickbooks   Attention to detail and accuracy, with excellent analytical and organizational skills.  Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks.   Chinese language is more priority.

Mô tả công việc  Công việc chính: Hỗ trợ Trưởng phòng kế toán trong việc bảo đảm tính chính xác và đầy đủ của chứng từ liên quan đến việc thanh toán, yêu cầu thanh toán trước khi chuyển tiền; và thực hiện các báo cáo kế toán/ tài chính khác.     Kiểm tra yêu cầu thanh toán của Nhà máy, của các bộ phận Nhân sự, Thu mua, Sales & Marketing, đảm bảo tính chính xác và đầy đủ của chứng từ.   Chuẩn bị các chứng từ cần thiết cho từng yêu cầu thanh toán để được sự phê duyệt của cấp trên   Lưu giữ, scan những tài liệu cần thiết và chuyển cho Giám sát kế toán để được sự phê duyệt của cấp trên.   Phối hợp với các nhà cung cấp về việc xuất hóa đơn bán hàng và lưu trữ thông tin trên hệ thống.   Theo dõi việc thanh toán so với việc giao hàng thực tế và chuẩn bị các báo cáo cần thiết để chuyển cho cấp trên xem xét, kiểm tra.   Chuẩn bị các hóa đơn bán hàng để chuyển cho nhà phân phối, đảm bảo số tiền mua hàng chính xác.   Mã hóa cho các nguyên vật liệu, bao bì, thành phẩm trên hệ thống kế toán.   Theo dõi, ghi nhận các giao dịch CAPEX (khấu hao, thanh lý, …)   Hỗ trợ Trưởng phòng kế toán hòan thành các báo cáo quản lý liên quan đến chi phí (chi phí điều hành, báo cáo thuế, những chi phí được xem là nguốn vốn công ty, …)   Đảm bảo tính bảo mật của các tài liệu cần thiết.   Thực hiện các công việc khác theo sự chỉ định    Cao đẳng

Trách nhiệm chính    1. Theo dõi hoạt động mua hàng và ghi nhận công nợ phải thanh toán :   - Lập kế hoạch thanh toán với nhà cung cấp hàng tháng, hàng tuần;  - Trực tiếp thực hiện nghiệp vụ thanh toán bằng tiền mặt hoặc qua ngân hàng cho nhà cung cấp như: đối chiếu công nợ, nhận hóa đơn, xem xét phiếu đề nghị thanh toán, lập phiếu chi;  - Thực hiện các nghiệp vụ chi nội bộ như trả lương, thanh toán tiền mua hàng bên ngoài;  - Theo dõi nghiệp vụ tạm ứng/hoàn ứng;  - Liên hệ với nhà cung cấp trong trường hợp kế hoạch thanh toán không đảm bảo;  - Kiểm tra tính hợp lý, hợp lê từ các bộ chứng từ thanh toán.   2. Theo dõi và quản lý công nợ khách hàng   · Kiểm tra theo dõi công tác thanh toán nợ phải trả từng nhà cung cấp, hạn nợ, thời gian nợ, số dư công nợ liên quan hàng tháng/định kỳ;  · Ghi nhận tiền trả cho từng nhà cung cấp và đối soát công nợ theo quy định;  · Định kỳ lập và gửi biên bản đối chiếu công nợ cho từng nhà cung cấp,...;  · Tổng hợp, đối chiếu, và ký xác nhận công nợ phải trả theo từng nhà cung cấp/tạm ứng phát sinh trong tháng so với hệ thống phần mềm;  · Các công việc khác được cấp trên giao.   3. Báo cáo ;  · Báo cáo tổng hợp chi phí hằng tuần/ tháng, dự kiến chi phí hằng tuần/ tháng;   · Báo cáo hợp đồng khách hàng, chiết khấu bán hàng hằng tuần/ tháng.       Yêu cầu   – Tốt nghiệp Đại Học chuyên ngành kế toán.  – Có kinh nghiệm 2 năm trở lên.  – Ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm kế toán thanh toán  – Ưu tiên ứng viên từng công tác tại các đơn vị Agency về truyền thông, quảng cáo, sự kiện.  – Trung thực, tỉ mỉ.  – Đam mê công việc kế toán.  – Có thể làm việc dưới áp lực cao.  – Anh văn giao tiếp, dịch tài liệu tốt.      Quyền lợi:   – Lương: Thoả thuận trong buổi phỏng vấn  – Làm việc từ thứ 2 đến thứ 6  – Được công ty tổ chức các lớp huấn luyện, đào tạo hội nhập và nâng cao chuyên môn.  – Được tham gia đầy đủ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN  – Du lịch: hàng năm sẽ có chuyến đi du lịch trong hoặc ngoài nước  – Thưởng lương tháng 13, chế độ nghỉ phép, sinh nhật, hiếu hỉ...theo quy định của công ty.

Tuyển dụng  Kiểm toán viên  Ứng tuyển   TIÊU CHUẨN YÊU CẦU   Để Trở Thành KIỂM TOÁN VIÊN NỘI BỘ Của Thuận Hải, Bạn Cần Đáp Ứng Các Tiêu Chí    Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên chuyên ngành Kế Toán/Kiểm Toán/Tài Chính và các ngành khác có liên quan;  Có ít nhất 4-5 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc làm việc trong lĩnh vực kiểm toán độc lập, kiểm toán nội bộ, kiểm soát nội bộ;  Ưu tiên các ứng viên đang theo học hoặc có các chứng chỉ chuyên ngành liên quan như APC, CPA, ACCA,...;  Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm (Office, BI) và biết cách khai thác dữ liệu các phần mềm chuyên dụng (ERP).  Có khả năng bao quát công việc, chủ động thực hiện công việc trong phạm vi được phân công.     YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC      Phối hợp Trưởng Ban lên kế hoạch kiểm toán, chương trình kiểm toán định kỳ, đột xuất. Thực hiện kiểm toán hoạt động, kiểm toán tuân thủ trong toàn bộ hoạt động sản xuất kinh doanh, quy chế, quy trình, quy định của pháp luật và nội bộ công ty; chứng từ sổ sách kế toán; báo cáo quản trị, báo cáo thuế, Báo cáo tài chính, ngân sách… tại Công ty mẹ và các công ty trong hệ thống.   Nhận định được các rủi ro phát sinh liên quan đến công tác kiểm toán nội bộ tại công ty để có thể tư vấn và đưa ra phương án khắc phục, quản trị rủi ro hiệu quả cho Công ty mẹ và các công ty trong hệ thống;   Thực hiện hoàn thiện Biên bản /báo cáo kiểm toán tới cấp quản lý trực tiếp;   Theo dõi và thực hiện các công tác hậu kiểm, phúc tra kiểm toán để đảm bảo các nội dung phát sinh đã được tuân thủ, sửa đổi;   Phát triển, chỉnh sửa, bổ sung, hoàn thiện phương pháp kiểm toán nội bộ và phạm vi hoạt động của kiểm toán nội bộ để có thể cập nhật, theo kịp sự phát triển của các công ty trong hệ thống;   Thực hiện các nhiệm vụ khác theo sự phân công của Trưởng Ban KSNB và Quy chế KTNB của Công ty.          QUYỀN LỢI     Thu nhập cạnh tranh (thỏa thuận theo năng lực);  Phụ cấp tiền cơm 30.000 đ / ngày + đài thọ miễn phí cơm trưa;  Tham gia đầy đủ BHXH theo quy định, gia tăng bảo hiểm sức khỏe;  Thưởng Lễ Tết, thưởng hiệu quả kinh doanh cuối năm (từ 1 – 3 tháng lương tùy vào hoạt động kinh doanh công ty trong năm), lương thâm niên, ...;  Được trang bị phòng tập gym, yoga hiện đại, cùng thiết bị hỗ trợ công tác tân tiến, xe đưa rước công tác, ...;  Tham gia các chương trình đào tạo công ty tổ chức để nâng cao kỹ năng & nghiệp vụ.  Làm việc tại Thuận Hải – công ty cung cấp giải pháp năng lượng hàng đầu Việt Nam (khối tư nhân), môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp cùng rất nhiều tiện ích;     THÔNG TIN KHÁC   Hồ sơ ứng tuyển gửi về email: tuyendung@thuanhai.com.vn

With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.   Position Purpose   The hotel-based Accountant role is responsible for supporting the Clustering finance department in managing financial transactions, ensuring accuracy in reporting, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards. This role contributes to the overall financial health of the hotel by assisting in accounts payable and receivable, preparing financial reports, and supporting daily operations.   Duties & Key Responsibilities    Accounts Payable     Account for and audit all items on purchase orders, receiving records, suppliers’ invoices, outgoing shipments, and credit notes.  Review all payments at the property level and forward them to the Cluster Assistant Director of Finance for approval and signature.  Ensure all invoices have supporting documentation attached before approval or payment.  Balance suppliers’ monthly statements with the hotel’s accounts payable records and follow up on missing invoices or credit notes.  Ensure invoices are approved by relevant Department Heads before payment.  Properly record, reconcile, and prepare invoices for payment, ensuring correct general ledger and cost centre codes are used.  Ensure the best rates are used for foreign currency payments and maintain confidentiality of bank account details.  Maintain an up-to-date filing system and handle all requests and inquiries in a timely and friendly manner.      Cost Management     Ensure security of all stores and proper access restrictions.  Verify that all incoming goods are received via the Receiving Area and checked against purchase orders.  Record and verify food and beverage invoices for accuracy against approved market prices. Conduct regular inspections of storerooms and receiving areas to ensure compliance with standards.  Maintain knowledge of the hotel’s inventory system and assist in training users on its operation.  Monitor stock levels and conduct monthly stock takes, ensuring accurate records of inventory receipts and issues.  Collaborate with the Cluster Purchasing Manager and department heads to minimize costs without sacrificing quality.      Income Audit     Collect all F&B bills and Front Office folio with supporting bills, ascertaining that the totals shown in agreement with trial balance reports.  Audit guest ledgers and all entertainment checks for propriety and authorization, then forward to Cluster Senior Accountant (IA) for review and approval, carrying out the same procedures for house use checks.  Maintain control record of Cashiers’ over / short and investigate major discrepancies and prepare monthly summary for approval, reporting material shortage immediately.  Check all void checks and prepare void list reports (F&B).  Control all coupons issued in regard to promotions, including group meals, in coordination with the Senior Accountant.      General Cashier Duties     Collect and count (with a witness from the Operations department) the contents of all cashiers’ envelopes on a daily basis.  Include all money orders in the daily deposit to the bank.  Prepare General Cashier’s Daily Report.  Provide all cashiers with change as required.  Reimburse cashiers for any disbursements / due backs made by them.  Properly account for all disbursements made from the General Cashier’s float.  Ensure that all cashiers and witness drop is properly noted in the drop log, highlighting any deviation.  Ensure that adequate security measures are in place in the transferring of funds to or from the hotel.  Provide clear instructions to cashiers on how to handle their funds and secure them from loss.  Ensure that the physical house funds in agreement with the house fund’s general ledger account and is reconciled on a monthly basis.  Bring any discrepancies or irregularities to the attention of the Cluster Director of Finance.  Safeguard and secure access to the General Cashier’s float and safe at all times.  Disburse petty cash only on the presentation of a petty cash voucher approved by the Cluster Director of Finance or in his / her absence.  Properly record, reconcile and prepare for reimbursement, the petty cash imprest on a weekly basis ensuring all transactions have supporting documentation.      Accounts Receivable      Collect and reconcile credit card transactions in the trial balance report with all sales slips.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all credit card charges.  Coordinate with the banks for credit draft capture issues.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all city ledgers.      Requirements     Previous experience in accounting or finance is preferred.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Qualifications     A bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent qualification preferred      Work Locations   Tru by Hilton Nam Dinh City Centre   Schedule   Full-time   Brand   Tru by Hilton   Job   Accounting
