Other tasks, i.e. admin supports for company events, CSR, internal audit, RB/GF changes, etc. will be assigned depending on her performance.       Qualifications    Education: Last-year students (major in English, Business Administration, Human Resources Management, Foreign Trade and Accounting) can commit to a full-time 6-month internship.  Fluent in both English and Vietnamese writing and speaking skill.  Master of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).  Personality: Careful, Willing to learn, Patient.  Good communication skills.       Additional Information    A learning-driven, professional, inclusive multinational work environment fosters personal growth and expands professional networks.  An attractive monthly allowance.  Bus transportation and lunch are provided daily.  Full-paid leaves for Vietnam public holidays, birthday, sickness and 01 day per working month. With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.   Position Purpose   The hotel-based Accountant role is responsible for supporting the Clustering finance department in managing financial transactions, ensuring accuracy in reporting, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards. This role contributes to the overall financial health of the hotel by assisting in accounts payable and receivable, preparing financial reports, and supporting daily operations.   Duties & Key Responsibilities    Accounts Payable     Account for and audit all items on purchase orders, receiving records, suppliers’ invoices, outgoing shipments, and credit notes.  Review all payments at the property level and forward them to the Cluster Assistant Director of Finance for approval and signature.  Ensure all invoices have supporting documentation attached before approval or payment.  Balance suppliers’ monthly statements with the hotel’s accounts payable records and follow up on missing invoices or credit notes.  Ensure invoices are approved by relevant Department Heads before payment.  Properly record, reconcile, and prepare invoices for payment, ensuring correct general ledger and cost centre codes are used.  Ensure the best rates are used for foreign currency payments and maintain confidentiality of bank account details.  Maintain an up-to-date filing system and handle all requests and inquiries in a timely and friendly manner.      Cost Management     Ensure security of all stores and proper access restrictions.  Verify that all incoming goods are received via the Receiving Area and checked against purchase orders.  Record and verify food and beverage invoices for accuracy against approved market prices. Conduct regular inspections of storerooms and receiving areas to ensure compliance with standards.  Maintain knowledge of the hotel’s inventory system and assist in training users on its operation.  Monitor stock levels and conduct monthly stock takes, ensuring accurate records of inventory receipts and issues.  Collaborate with the Cluster Purchasing Manager and department heads to minimize costs without sacrificing quality.      Income Audit     Collect all F&B bills and Front Office folio with supporting bills, ascertaining that the totals shown in agreement with trial balance reports.  Audit guest ledgers and all entertainment checks for propriety and authorization, then forward to Cluster Senior Accountant (IA) for review and approval, carrying out the same procedures for house use checks.  Maintain control record of Cashiers’ over / short and investigate major discrepancies and prepare monthly summary for approval, reporting material shortage immediately.  Check all void checks and prepare void list reports (F&B).  Control all coupons issued in regard to promotions, including group meals, in coordination with the Senior Accountant.      General Cashier Duties     Collect and count (with a witness from the Operations department) the contents of all cashiers’ envelopes on a daily basis.  Include all money orders in the daily deposit to the bank.  Prepare General Cashier’s Daily Report.  Provide all cashiers with change as required.  Reimburse cashiers for any disbursements / due backs made by them.  Properly account for all disbursements made from the General Cashier’s float.  Ensure that all cashiers and witness drop is properly noted in the drop log, highlighting any deviation.  Ensure that adequate security measures are in place in the transferring of funds to or from the hotel.  Provide clear instructions to cashiers on how to handle their funds and secure them from loss.  Ensure that the physical house funds in agreement with the house fund’s general ledger account and is reconciled on a monthly basis.  Bring any discrepancies or irregularities to the attention of the Cluster Director of Finance.  Safeguard and secure access to the General Cashier’s float and safe at all times.  Disburse petty cash only on the presentation of a petty cash voucher approved by the Cluster Director of Finance or in his / her absence.  Properly record, reconcile and prepare for reimbursement, the petty cash imprest on a weekly basis ensuring all transactions have supporting documentation.      Accounts Receivable      Collect and reconcile credit card transactions in the trial balance report with all sales slips.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all credit card charges.  Coordinate with the banks for credit draft capture issues.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all city ledgers.      Requirements     Previous experience in accounting or finance is preferred.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Qualifications     A bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent qualification preferred      Work Locations   Tru by Hilton Thai Binh City Centre   Schedule   Full-time   Brand   Tru by Hilton   Job   Accounting

Yêu cầu:  Sinh viên năm 4 các trường cao đẳng, đại học chuyên ngành Kinh tế, Quản lý lao động, Quản trị nhân lực, Quản trị kinh doanh, Luật, Quản trị văn phòng, …  Ngoại hình: ưa nhìn  Có hiểu biết về tin học văn phòng: Word, Excel, …  Ham học hỏi, có kỹ năng giao tiếp, nhanh nhẹn, hoạt bát.  Chăm chỉ, cẩn thận, tinh thần trách nhiệm cao, yêu thích nghề Nhân sự.  Ưu tiên ứng viên có khả năng hoạt náo, văn nghệ, …   Quyền lợi:  Được trải nghiệm môi trường doanh nghiệp trẻ, hoạt động văn hóa sôi nổi tại FPTS  Được tiếp xúc và thực tế tham gia vào công việc của Ban Nhân sự FPTS;  Được hướng dẫn tận tình cũng như hỗ trợ đầy đủ công cụ, tài liệu cần thiết trong quá trình học hỏi, đào tạo trong lĩnh vực Nhân sự   Được tham gia các hoạt động, event, các khóa đào tạo nội bộ tại FPTS Hà Nội.  Được hỗ trợ và tạo điều kiện hoàn thành các báo cáo thực tập và xác nhận thời gian thực tập tại FPTS   Nộp hồ sơ    Gửi bản mềm CV tới hòm mail: bannhansu@fpts.com.vn. Sie haben ein Herz für Maschinen? Dann sind Sie bei  HANSA-FLEX  genau richtig! Unsere Mission ist es, Maschinen mit modernster Hydraulik (wieder) zum Laufen zu bringen. Ob Schläuche, Rohre, Pumpen oder Zylinder: Unsere hohen Qualitätsansprüche und unser unermüdlicher Einsatz für den Kunden haben uns zu einem der international führenden Unternehmen für hydraulische Verbindungstechnik gemacht. Das höchste Gut unseres Familienunternehmens sind dabei unsere 4.000 Mitarbeiter*innen.  Zur Unterstützung der kaufmännischen Abläufe im Produktionsbereich Zylinder-Zentrum in 07613 Heideland / OT Königshofen suchen wir eine vielseitige kaufmännische Assistenz (m/w/d) als kaufmännischen Innendienstmitarbeiter (m/w/d).   Ihre Aufgaben     Sie schreiben Angebote und holen alle erforderlichen Daten dazu ein  Zu Ihrem Tagesgeschäft gehört die sorgfältige Erfassung und Pflege von Daten in SAP  Sie führen Bestellungen durch, samt Rechnungskontrolle  Auch Lieferscheine werden von Ihnen bearbeitet  Gewissenhaft übernehmen Sie den Schriftverkehr und die Ablage    Was erwarten wir von Ihnen?    Mit einer kaufmännischen Ausbildung, z. B zum Fachkaufmann, zur Fachkauffrau für Büromanagement bzw. Büro- und Projektorganisation oder auch zur Industriekauffrau, zum Industriekaufmann, sind Sie ideal vorbereitet  Wir freuen uns über Erfahrung mit vergleichbaren Aufgaben im Office-Management oder als Teamassistenz  Idealerweise bringen Sie technisches Verständnis mit  Routiniert gehen Sie mit Office-Anwendungen und SAP um  Sie geben Struktur, organisieren mit gutem Überblick und sind Ihrem Team gegenüber stets hilfsbereit    Können wir Ihre Erwartungen erfüllen?    Auch wenn Sie natürlich schon Know-how mitbringen, gehört es für uns zu einem guten Start dazu, wenn Sie sich gut vorbereitet fühlen – freuen Sie sich auf eine sorgfältige Einarbeitung.  Unser Betriebsklima stimmt – ob im kommunikativen Tagesgeschäft oder bei regelmäßigen gemeinsamen Aktivitäten – wir versuchen, uns auch jenseits des Fachlichen zu sehen.  Genau wie unsere Kunden können Sie sich auf uns verlassen – für Ihre Gesundheit bieten wir ein Firmenfitnessprogramm, für Ihre persönliche Flexibilität ein Langzeitkonto. Eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge halten wir für selbstverständlich.

Summary of Role  V-Key is one of the world’s leading deep-tech companies in mobile cybersecurity. Our patented technology V-OS has been deployed by top banks, mobile payment providers, and governments to secure software solutions and protect more than 500 million application installation globally.  We are rapidly expanding into new markets and new customer segments. Apart from securing digital transactions for everyone, we are also enabling new generation technology by providing the cybersecurity infrastructure for banking, government and smart homes, among many others.  At V-Key, we are building towards a future where technology users can enjoy unprecedented security and convenience.  We are looking for an Admin and HR Assistant (Intern) as part of Corporate – Human Resources Department.  Duties and Responsibilities    Welcome and support new joiners  Monitor and manage the pantry and office supplies  Prepare materials for meetings, events, and travel arrangements  Organize company events and activities to promote a positive work environment  Handle administrative tasks including purchasing, office maintenance, pantry supplies, stationery, business trip preparations  Prepare and submit expense claims  Process payments for vendors  Complete assigned administrative tasks from HR & Office Manager     Requirements     Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Human Resources or relevant qualifications  Proficient in MS Office  Strong problem-solving skills, strong communication, interpersonal, and research skills  High sense of responsibility  Customer support-oriented mindset.  Proactive, resourceful, and solutions-focused  Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and thoroughness  Well-organized with can-do attitude  Strong emotional control skills  Ability to communicate effectively in English with global workforce (preferred)

Company Description    Saigon Social  is a food and drink experience and travel agency in Vietnam, curated by acclaimed food and drink writer  Jovel Chan . From  artisanal fish sauce  to  rice wine  and the country’s  first-of-its-kind Vietnamese craft liquor tasting , Saigon Social goes beyond the usual street food crawl to uncover the craftsmanship, history, and culture behind Vietnam’s most iconic flavours, dishes and ingredients.      Whether you're a curious traveller, a discerning foodie, or a hospitality professional, our one-of-a-kind experiences are designed to be immersive, intimate, and led by passionate tastemakers. This isn’t just a food tour—it’s an invitation to go deep.      Role Description   We’re looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented  Operations Assistant  to help manage the logistics and execution of our food and drink experiences. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves food and culture, and has strong problem-solving skills.     Key Responsibilities     Tour & Experience Coordination:  Assist in scheduling and managing bookings, ensuring smooth execution of experiences.   Guest Communication:  Handle inquiries, confirmations, and special requests before and after tours.   Logistics & Vendor Liaison:  Work with guides, restaurants, bars, and artisans to coordinate schedules and ensure seamless experiences.   On-the-Ground Support:  Be present at key events and tours to assist with setup, guest needs, and troubleshooting.   Admin & Reporting:  Maintain records, manage payments, and track performance metrics for continuous improvement.      Qualifications   Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.  Excellent communication skills in  English and Vietnamese .  Experience in hospitality, tourism, or event coordination is a plus.  Passion for food, drink, and Vietnamese culture.  Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends when needed.      Why Join Us?   Work in a dynamic, fast-growing company at the forefront of Vietnam’s food scene.  Get hands-on experience in curating and executing unique culinary experiences.  Collaborate with top chefs, bartenders, and artisans for one-of-a-kind events       How to Apply:   Send your resume and a short cover letter to jovel@jovelchan.com. Tell us why you’re excited about this role and what makes you a great fit!

Job Purpose   We are seeking a proactive Temporary Change Management Specialist to join our IT Division for an 8-month period. The ideal candidate will have strong writing skills, coordination and reporting abilities, and good design skills. This role is crucial in supporting the division's transformation from processes to culture by organizing events, crafting internal communications, designing newsletters, and generating necessary reports.   Key Accountabilities (1)     Support Change Initiatives: Assist in driving change within the IT Division by organizing division-wide events, activities, and trainings.    Internal Communication: Write clear and concise internal communications to effectively convey directives and announcements across the division.    Design Work: Create visually appealing newsletters and other communication materials using Canva and PowerPoint.    Reporting: Generate and analyze reports to track progress and impact of change initiatives.    Event Coordination: Plan and execute events that promote cultural and process changes within the division. Job Number   2025-221   Application Deadline   3/14/2025   Position Start Date   3/17/2025  Position Title Secretary I (NY HELPS) Required Application Type School Related Personnel Salary/Pay Scale $32,117- $37,000 prorated to amount of service Job Description   LOCATION:  Special Education – Maywood Academy   Basic Function   The work involves responsibility for independently performing complex clerical operations and administrative support tasks for a unit in a Division. Incumbents spend a substantial amount of time operating a personal computer and the rest of the time on routine administrative tasks to ensure the efficient workflow of the office. The work also involves responsibility for the entry and retrieval of information using software on a computer and using a computer to produce printed material such as letters, memoranda and forms. Incumbents work under general supervision receiving detailed instructions only where policies have not been determined. This class differs from that of Secretary II by the increased time spent on operating software and the more limited scope of duties and decision-making responsibilities. Does related work as required.   Responsibilities     Prepares correspondence, documents, records and other written material in final or draft form using computer software from handwritten, rough drafts, marked copy, oral recordings or data from various equipment as the source material.  Transcribes correspondence from dictation equipment.  Composes and prepares correspondence on matters where policies and procedures are well defined.  Maintains and updates database/spreadsheet records on a personal computer.  Screens callers or visitors to determine the nature of the inquiry and refers to appropriate party or office and answers inquiries as appropriate.  Schedules conferences, meetings and makes travel arrangements.  Establishes and maintains confidential and general office files.  Explains established program policies and procedures to the general public/clients and obtains routine information for program purposes.  Receives, sorts and distributes incoming mail.  Checks, codes and processes requisitions, claims and bills.  Prepares and maintains financial, statistical and personnel records.  Monitors and tracks status of program activities.  Orders supplies and materials.  Collects and gathers information to be used as a basis for reports and memoranda and prepares summaries.  Transmits instructions from supervisor to staff and follows up to ensure deadlines are met.  Answers telephone and gives out information.  Good knowledge of modern office terminology, procedures, equipment and business English.  Good knowledge of the organization, functions, laws, policies and regulations, and terminology of the agency to which assigned.  Ability to handle routine administrative details independently.  Ability to operate a personal computer and utilize common office software programs including word processing, spreadsheet and databases at an acceptable rate of accuracy and speed.  Ability to prepare and maintain program records and routine reports.  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.  Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.  Ability to organize and maintain office files.  Ability to collect information from various sources for program operations.  Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the position.    Civil Service Title Secretary I Job Qualifications    Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university or one accredited by the New York State Board of Regents to grant degrees with an Associate’s degree in secretarial science or a closely related field and one (1) year of clerical experience which involved the operation of a computer for word-processing, database or spreadsheet applications; OR,  Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience as defined in (A)     PROMOTIONAL : Twelve (12) months’ permanent competitive status as a Senior Typist or Senior Keyboard Specialist.   The selected applicant will be subject to a fingerprint supported criminal history background check in accordance with SAVE Legislation effective July 1, 2001.      Candidates will not have to take an exam for this title   . This is a NY HELPS (Hiring Emergency Limited Placement Statewide) Program designated title. NY HELPS is a temporary program designed to help local government employers address current staffing issues. Traditionally, the titles filled under the NY HELPS Program required job candidates to compete in a competitive exam to be considered for employment. For the duration of the program, this title will be classified as non-competitive and categorized as a HELPS Program position. At the close of the program, this position will revert to competitive class status. Employees occupying positions filled through the HELPS Program will be granted competitive class status without the need to participate in a competitive exam.    Job Category Professional/Administrative Positions Job Location Capital District Region  Additional Information

*According to Decree No.13/2023/ND-CP on protecting personal data (“PDP”), Home Credit Vietnam would apply "Personal Data Processing Agreement" with all candidates to ensure compliance with the decree.      By submitting this application to Home Credit Vietnam Finance Company Limited through LinkedIn, you agree to allow Home Credit to proceed your provided information in accordance with Personal Data Processing Agreement that you have read, fully understood and agreed to the entire content at link    https://career.homecredit.vn/vn/article/id/217  .       KEY RESPONSIBILITIES    1. Secretary   Coordinate and be mainly responsible for:   Agenda organizing and managing appointments and meeting of the Chief Legal & Compliance Officer;  Taking notes and minutes of meetings of L&C division and inter-divisions;  Preparing notes, presentations, and other documentations for the Chief L&C Officer and other members of L&C division upon requested;  Checking and managing the approval process for internal documents;  Supporting the communications within the L&C division as well as inter-divisions;  Screening telephone calls, enquiries, and requests from other divisions and departments to L&C division;  Collect and/or coordinate for the reports required from L&C divisions (as instructed by the Chief L&C Officer); and  Other secretary tasks as assigned by the Chief L&C Officer.       2. Administration   Coordinate and be mainly responsible for all administrative works of L&C division, in particular:   Tracking and monitoring the costs and expenses of L&C division (e.g., taxi, travel, accommodation, etc.,);  Managing all the daily routine admin tasks of L&C division (e.g., stationary and office supplies management, newspaper arrangement, mails management, courier services, etc.);  Processing all purchasing and payment activities for L&C division;  Tracking and updating the organization chart and the functions and tasks of L&C division upon instructed by the Chief L&C Officer;  Organizing and coordinating the team building activities, off-sites, team training, business trips and similar activities and events;  Providing administrative supports and assistance to all members of L&C division; and  Other administrative tasks as assigned by the Chief L&C Officer.       3. Legal Works:    Research, analyze and provide legal consultation for various aspects during operations of the company;  Prepare, draft, revise, review and/or provide comments on all agreements, templates, internal regulations and/or other documents related to the Company;  Provide Legal Update of new Regulations as well as translation of contracts and other materials (where necessary);       4. Others    Provide other general supports and assistance to other members of L&C division upon being requested by the Chief L&C Officer.       JOB REQUIREMENTS    University degree is preferred;  Law education background is preferred;  Advanced knowledge of MS Office tools;  Experience in admin works with good attention to details and organizational skills.  Experience with budget planning and management;  Advanced English communication and writing skills.       COMPENSATIONS & BENEFITS    13th Salary Fixed and KPI Bonus.  Premium Health Care.  24/7 Accidental Insurance.  100% Social Insurance.  Meal + Phone Allowance.  Yearly Medical Checkup.  15 Annual Leaves.  Professional and Transparent Working Environment.  Apply Latest Financial Technology in the World.

I. MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC     Soạn thảo, xử lý và lưu trữ các văn bản, công văn, báo cáo;  Thực hiện các công tác Hành chính văn phòng: Quản lý điều xe, phòng họp, con dấu, văn bản, công tác tâm linh; Cơm ca, hỗ trợ quản lý nhà ở công vụ;  Trực tiếp quản lý tài sản, thiết bị văn phòng và các tài sản, công cụ dụng cụ, trang thiết bị văn phòng...;  Lập kế hoạch ngân sách, mua sắm; trình/thực hiện thủ tục thanh toán các trang thiết bị, chi phí liên quan đến phòng công vụ, chi phí hoạt động văn phòng Công ty theo quy định;  Hỗ trợ tổ chức và thực hiện công tác hậu cần cho việc tổ chức sự kiện, tiệc, lễ tết,... cho Công ty;  Hỗ trợ công tác tuyển dụng, đào tạo và quản lý nhân sự;  Thực hiện các đầu công việc khác theo sự phân công của cấp trên.     II. YÊU CẦU     Tốt nghiệp Cao đẳng/Đại học trở lên chuyên ngành Quản trị nhân lực, Hành chính, Kinh tế, Ngoại ngữ, hoặc các ngành liên quan;  Tối thiểu 02 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực Hành chính văn phòng;  Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm tin học văn phòng (Word, Excel,...);  Tinh thần chủ động, cẩn thận, trách nhiệm cao trong công việc.     III. QUYỀN LỢI    Sun World Là Tập Đoàn Vui Chơi Giải Trí Hàng Đầu Việt Nam Với Môi Trường Vô Cùng Năng Động, Chuyên Nghiệp Và Phát Triển Không Ngừng Với Nhiều Cơ Hội Phát Triển Nghề Nghiệp. Đến Với Sun World, Người Lao Động Sẽ Được Hưởng Những Quyền Lợi Như    Hưởng mức lương hấp dẫn kèm theo như hỗ trợ nhà ở và các phụ cấp ăn ca, gửi xe,…;  Có lương tháng 13 và thưởng cuối năm theo thành tích công việc;  Thưởng hiệu quả kinh doanh hàng tháng;  Tham gia bảo hiểm đầy đủ theo quy định pháp luật và quyền lợi bảo hiểm sức khỏe Suncare;  Được ưu đãi đặc biệt khi sử dụng dịch vụ tại các Khu vui chơi, giải trí cho bản thân và gia đình theo chế độ dành cho CBNV;  Được đào tạo nâng cao nghiệp vụ liên tục;  Có chính sách “An cư lạc nghiệp” - cấp căn hộ thương mại (100% giá trị) đối với cán bộ nhân viên có thâm niên.

Location:  Vietnam  City:  Hanoi  Contract Type:  Staff  Grade:  X4  Salary scale:  Country Scale  Contract Duration:  12 months (possibility of extension)  Deadline:  21/02/2025  Job Reference:  RP25-26   Position Summary   To support program delivery in Vietnam, GGGI is seeking a Program Assistant to execute administrative and project-related tasks. The Program Assistant will play a critical role in ensuring the effective operation of administrative activities, including organizing events, arranging travel, managing supply chain recruitment, procurement, scheduling for the Country Representative, overseeing office assets, and other administrative services. The Program Assistant will work under the supervision of the focal point of the Operations Enabling Division (OED) and the Vietnam Country Representative, supporting Vietnam programs and collaborating with other team members in the Vietnam office.   PURPOSE   The Program Assistant will support the Vietnam Country Office, ensuring smooth daily operations. This role involves managing administrative tasks, organizing schedules, and assisting with relevant operational assignments as needed.   ENGAGEMENT   Under The Guidance Of The Country Representative And OED Focal Point, The Program Assistant Will Perform The Following Tasks Related To GGGI's Country Programs In Vietnam    Administrative Support: Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate travel arrangements for the Country Representative and project teams.  Project Coordination: Assist with ongoing projects, track progress, and follow up on deadlines.     DELIVERY    Administrative Support   Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:    Organize meetings and provide logistical support, including scheduling and documentation.  Monitor and maintain office supplies and assets, ensuring appropriate use and updating inventory and asset records.  Support financial functions, including managing the office budget, expense tracking, and petty cash reconciliation.  Coordinate logistical arrangements for GGGI events and workshops, acting as the main coordinator for event delivery.  Prepare for staff onboarding processes, including visa processing, work permit exemptions, and temporary resident cards for international experts in GGGI Vietnam.     Project Coordination Support     Assist with implementing project procedures and tools to ensure smooth transactions and output delivery.  Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, reports, and meeting notes.     Other Tasks     Perform any additional duties assigned by the Country Representative or Project Manager.     Requirements   QUALIFICATIONS    Undergraduate degree.  At least 1 year of professional experience in administration, logistics, or procurement (preferred).  Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and applications.  Fluent in English and Vietnamese (both written and spoken).  Self-motivated, detail-oriented, with strong organizational skills.    FUNCTIONAL    Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.  Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.  Experience working in an international/multicultural environment.  Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite).  Previous administrative or assistant experience preferred.    CORPORATE    Ability to process and share information effectively and solve problems proactively.  Manage emotions and stress positively, build rapport, and resolve conflicts with ease.  Promote creativity and innovation within the team.  Work effectively with diverse teams, both culturally and professionally.      Child protection – GGGI is committed to child protection, irrespective of whether any specific area of work involves direct contact with children. GGGI’s Child Protection Policy is written in accordance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child.

Opportunities for professional growth and development.    Travel perks and discounts.    Be part of a dynamic and supportive team.

Mô tả công việc    Hỗ trợ các công việc hành chính văn phòng: Thực hiện các công việc như: Gửi thư, chuẩn bị đón khách, ăn trưa, mua quà tặng khách hàng, gửi quà tặng khách hàng, chuẩn bị quà trong các sự kiện...  Tặng quà sinh nhật khách hàng:    ○ Cập nhật danh sách sinh nhật của khách hàng.  ○ Tặng quà sinh nhật cho khách hàng.    Phụ trách lưu trữ dữ liệu bản cứng: Quản lý (Sắp xếp, lưu trữ) các hồ sơ bản cứng, ấn phẩm, quà tặng văn phòng, sách, tạp chí...  Quản lý các công tác thu/chi nội bộ: Theo dõi các thu/chi liên quan đến văn phòng như: Chuyển phát nhanh, điện nước, in ấn, quỹ chung....  Biên dịch tài liệu: Dịch các tài liệu chuyên ngành Coach từ tiếng Anh sang tiếng Việt  Thiết kế tài liệu power point: Thiết kế, hiệu chỉnh chỉnh slide...cho các khoá học, webinar theo yêu cầu  Admin zoom: Tham gia quá trình quản lý phòng Zoom khi tổ chức các sự kiện.  Hỗ trợ trực các kênh truyền thông của Công ty: Phối hợp cùng sale: Trả lời, chăm sóc khách hàng trên các kênh chatbox, fanpage, hubspot....  Hỗ trợ phát triển nội dung trên các kênh truyền thông Viết bài, chia sẻ... nhằm thu hút, duy trì tương tác trên các kênh mạng xã hội của công ty (bao gồm Facebook, Website, Youtube, Linked In)  Hỗ trợ team truyền thông: Phối hợp cùng truyền thông thực hiện các công việc như:    Chụp ảnh, kết nối, hậu cần khi có các sự kiện như: Khóa đào tạo, workshop, buổi chia sẻ, tri ân...    Phối hợp cùng Project Coordinator: Làm các yêu cầu do PC yêu cầu trong từng tình huống cụ thể.    Không yêu cầu

About the Company:   Flex Living is a rapidly growing start-up based in London that strives to be the leading provider of short-stay accommodation worldwide. We take pride in our commitment to excellence, thought leadership, and a culture of transparency. Our team is hardworking and dedicated to delivering exceptional customer service that exceeds expectations.  We are seeking new members to join our team who are fast learners and hard workers with a desire to grow with the company.   Job Summary:   Flex Living is seeking a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support the day-to-day operations of our flexible accommodation business. The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing administrative tasks, ensuring smooth communication between teams, and providing exceptional support to our clients.   Qualifications and Skills:     Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.   Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.   Ability to multitask, prioritize, and meet deadlines.   Proficiency in productivity tools such as Microsoft Office, Google Workspace, and project management tools (e.g., Trello, Asana, or Slack).   Familiarity with customer relationship management (CRM) software is a plus.   Tech-savvy with the ability to learn new tools quickly.      Key Attributes:     Proactive and self-motivated.   Customer-focused mindset with problem-solving skills.   High level of confidentiality and professionalism.   Adaptable to a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.      Requirements:   To be considered for this position, you must meet the following requirements:     Fluent in written and verbal English   A reliable mobile phone, laptop, and internet connection   Availability to work weekends on a rotating basis   Ability to work more than the normal working hours and extra days when needed   A desire to commit to a long-term career with our company     What We Offer:     Competitive pay.   Work-from-home flexibility.   Opportunity to grow within a fast-scaling company.   Collaborative and supportive team environment.      Working Hours:   The standard working hours for this position are from 8 am to 5 pm UK time during the week.  6 working days with 1 day off (Sunday), this will become 5 working days with 2 days off when you get promoted to senior distribution assistant.

Main Responsibilities: - Update Sales Figures, weekly sales performance, monthly Forecast report - Prepare and Present Reports  - Maintain an Accurate Database of Customer and Prospect Information  - Direct feedback from customers to CS  - Track & follow documents procedure between Metrohealth and customer (contract, quotation, PO, debt, rebate annex, delivery note)   - Prepare internal document work: proposal, order request forms, delivery note, Promotion tracking form, document for seminar& group customer, vendor code (create & activate), send sample for testing …  - Handle meetings, seminars….  - Partner with supply chain to keep tracking the goods status   - Calculate Sales incentive (monthly, quarterly..)  - Receiving, processing purchase orders, delivery and payment   - Be responsible for hotel reservation and checking air ticket booking for colleagues' in Business Unit - Follow up the bidding if any  - Ad-hoc tasks       About Zoetis       At   Zoetis  , our purpose is to nurture the world and humankind by advancing care for animals. As a Fortune 500 company and the world leader in animal health, we discover, develop, manufacture and commercialize vaccines, medicines, diagnostics and other technologies for companion animals and livestock. We know our people drive our success. Our award-winning culture, built around our Core Beliefs, focuses on our colleagues' careers, connection and support. We offer competitive healthcare and retirement savings benefits, along with an array of benefits, policies and programs to support employee well-being in every sense, from health and financial wellness to family and lifestyle resources.        Diversity, Equity & Inclusion       Connected to our purpose and Core Beliefs, at Zoetis, we lead with inclusion. Our Diversity, Equity & Inclusion (DE&I) focus helps create an environment where each colleague can thrive. Our commitment to DE&I begins with our leadership team of diverse backgrounds, experiences and ethnicities  , and it is demonstrated in our support of our colleagues and the animal health industry. We have nine colleague resources groups whose members spread awareness, foster inclusivity and make a positive impact on our business and communities.     Our commitment to advancing Diversity, Equity and Inclusion has earned us recognitions as a 2024 Catalyst Award recipient and a Top 50 Company for Workplace Fairness by Fair360 (formerly DiversityInc). Zoetis has also been named a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ+ Equality, a Best Company for Working Parents, a Top Company for Executive Women, among many others. Learn more    here   . Managing Vendors (Minor):     	•	Quaterly / Add-hoc auditing for vendor performance, optimize workflows, and manage onboarding processes.       WORKING TIME & SALARY     Salary: start from   25,000 - 30.000 VND   / hour (depending on experience, review after 3 months) + Parking / Transportation allowance    Working time: Flexible (Minimum 4 days in office, 25 hours / week)     JOB REQUIREMENTS     Highly intelligent, motivated, detail-oriented & extreme ownership    Very good critical thinking & analytical skills. DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.     We are looking for a  bilingual professional  to join our team and teach AI chatbots. You will have conversations in both Vietnamese and English with chatbots in order to measure their progress, as well as write novel conversations in order to teach them what to say.     Benefits:   This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position  You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on  You can work on your own schedule  Projects are paid hourly, starting at $20+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work      Responsibilities (both in Vietnamese and English):   Come up with diverse conversations over a range of topics  Write high-quality answers when given specific prompts  Compare the performance of different AI models  Research and fact-check AI responses      Qualifications:   Fluent in Vietnamese + English  A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)  Excellent writing and grammar skills  Strong research and fact-checking skills to ensure accuracy and originality      Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD.

About us:   Founded in 2020, Var Meta has 80+ engineers heavily focused on blockchain, virtual reality/augmented reality technologies and AI. Manage and maintain the CEO's schedule, including scheduling appointments, meetings, and events.    Handle phone calls, emails, and correspondence on behalf of the executive, prioritizing and responding as needed.    Organize travel arrangements, including flights, hotels, and ground transportation.    Manage expense reports and track receipts for reimbursement.    Assist with research and preparation of reports and presentations.    Attend meetings with the executive, take notes, and provide follow-up as needed.    Handle confidential information with discretion and maintain a high level of professionalism at all times.    Perform general administrative tasks such as filing, data entry, and ordering supplies.    Your Skills and Experience:    High school diploma or equivalent; Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred.    1+ years of experience as a personal assistant or in a similar administrative support role.    Excellent organizational and time management skills.    Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.    Proficient in Microsoft Office and Google Suite.    Ability to work independently and prioritize tasks effectively.    Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.    Ability to maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information with discretion.    Professional and friendly demeanor.    Why You'll Love Working Here:    Working directly with business owners to define opportunities together and build Go To Market strategy.     Working on Blockchain / Metaverse Consulting Projects for International Clients     Build your high-level valuable global enterprise connections     Travel opportunities to many countries around the world (EU, US, AU, JP, SEA)    Learning culture: At Var Meta, we believe that people are key to the success of a company, so we invest in training whether it is communication skills, technical skills.     Enjoy competitive salary, bonus according to work performance    13th Salary    Assistance with operational tools and equipment. Annual health check-up from Medlatec Clinic    Participate in social insurance after becoming an official employee    Salary review twice a year. It means we are pushing each other to be better everyday.    Flexible working hours, freestyle attire.    Perks You'll Enjoy:    Working in a young, super talented, and supportive team environment    Technical, English certificate bonus     Day-off: 12 days/year and Vietnam holidays    Happy Hour, Football club, English club, and many exciting activities    Company trip/ team building/ Year End Party    Free coffee, snacks, and drinks. Way beyond a simple consulting firm, Source of Asia is an international business accelerator. In simple words, we enable our customers to explore, operate and grow business in Vietnam, across ASEAN, and further afield. We thrive on challenges, permanently motivated to learn and grow along the way. We believe success lies in the human relationships we build. This dynamic environment is the ideal gateway for talents, who believe, like we do, in sustainable growth. Our fast-growing company is permanently looking for new talents.    The following job description pertains to an external position that we are currently hiring for on behalf of our client. Submit your application today!      Main Responsibilities   1. Admin task:    Work with several suppliers to deliver great services to employee relates to hotel, flight ticket and accommodation. Follow up and accomplish payment process with the suppliers.  Manage office stationery, which includes: receive purchase request, create check-list to follow-up on import and export, deliver and clear out stationery on monthly basis.  Receive, categorize, and deliver posts, documents, etc. to related department/staff. Record & check-up on sent-out posts as well as post-fee    2. Reception task:    Greet & welcome guests as soon as they arrive at the office, and direct them to the appropriate person and office.  Answer, screen and forward incoming phone calls.  Ensure reception area is tidy and presentable, with all necessary stationery and material (e.g. pens, forms and brochures).      Requirements   Bachelor degree in Economics/Business Administration or others   1.5 – 2 years experience  in administrative jobs  Good command of English, especially communication skills  Highly proficient in spoken and written Vietnamese language skills  Passionate for delivering good service      Benefits   Salary range from 10-12 million VND Gross with allowance, bonus and 13th-month salary  Social Insurance – Medical Insurance – Unemployment Insurance regulated by Vietnam Labor Law  Health care checks annually following the company policy  Free of snacks in the pantry area for employees  Working in a fresh, active, multinational environment  Training & Coaching provided by experts  Performance and salary review annually      You can apply directly via this link: https://bit.ly/soa-admin-cum-recep

Company Description   The Pullman Vung Tau Hotel features 356 rooms with contemporary designs inspired by the creative and vibrant coastal city life, offering guests a "bleisure" experience — a perfect balance between work and leisure. Our conference and event center spans over 2,321 square meters, comprising 2 grand ballrooms and 4 meeting rooms equipped with state-of-the-art facilities, accommodating up to 1200 guests. Guests can also meet, entertain, or relax while enjoying distinct and enticing culinary experiences at Riviera Restaurant with an international à la carte menu, Corniche Ultra Lounge serving Tapas or experiencing delightful beverages at the Lobby Bar or Poolside Bar. The Fit Lounge is open 24/7, and the outdoor pool bathed in natural light, complemented by Pullman's unique amenities such as the Welcomer service, Signature Pullman bedding, Connectivity Lounge, and Co-Meeting criteria, ensuring a satisfying stay for all guests.   Job Description   GENERAL MISSION    To ensure the efficient administration of the Executive Office.  To assist directly the General Manager in his responsibilities.     Responsibilities And Means     Ensures that the day to day administrative needs are fulfilled.  Be responsible for rendering secretarial and clerical services for the General Manager.  Keeps all information confidential.     Technical Responsibilities     Inputs in the computer specific data when requested.  Handles telephone incoming/outgoing calls.  Arranges appointments for, and reminds of appointments and meetings.  Keep files in good order.  Handle different kind of bookings for owning companies  Be in charge of expatriate contract follow-up including IMS, renewal, local language translation.  Duty arrangements for department heads.  Operation smile donnation register.  Maintain proper communication including follow up with owning company, shareholders and Accor office.  Assisting AAPC office’s employees for entry visa to Vietnam.  Coordinate & arranging airline tickets & accomodation, visa for GM and department heads trips.  Be responsible for the good order/cleanliness of own work area and equipment.  Monitors the casual staff requisitions of departments.  Follows up with approval of casual staff orders submitted by department heads and sends these orders to the supplier in most proper ways.  Coordinates with the supplier in effective manner to make sure all casual staff fully attends the operations in terms of working schedule, quantity as required in the casual staff orders.  Ensures casual staff strictly follows grooming standards, working regulations and hotel rules.  Handles complaints and proposes solutions for problems concerning to employment of casual staff in daily operations.  Ensures the accuracy of casual staff attendance record. Prepares monthly payment report and other reports as required by hotel management.     Commercial Responsibilities     Handles suppliers when requested.     Administrative Responsibilities     Records and transcribes minutes of meetings.  Drafts routine or simple correspondence as assigned.  Typing correspondence, memorandums, circulars, reports etc  Opens/dispatches mail relative to the division.  Maintains office supplies.  Performs special duties in relation with the division when requested.     Human Resource Responsibilities     Handles human relation duties for employees.  Sees that employee’s complaints, needs are passed on to the General Manager.  Conducts oriented training programs of Accor Group for employees in a regular basis.    REPLACEMENT AND TEMPORARY MISSION    Performs other related duties and special projects as directed by the General Manager.     Qualifications    Essential Qualifications     Education:   A bachelor's degree in hospitality management, business administration, or a related field (optional but advantageous).  Relevant certifications in office management or secretarial courses are a plus.   Experience:   Previous experience in a PA, Executive Assistant, or similar role.  Familiarity with the hospitality industry is highly desirable.   Technical Skills:   Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) and hotel management software.  Excellent typing speed and document preparation skills.  Familiarity with scheduling tools and communication platforms.     Responsibilities To Prepare For     Managing the GM’s calendar, arranging meetings, and coordinating travel plans.  Acting as a liaison between the GM and hotel departments or external contacts.  Preparing reports, presentations, and correspondence on behalf of the GM.  Taking notes during meetings and ensuring follow-up on action points.  Assisting with guest relations and handling VIP or special requests.  Keeping the GM informed about hotel performance, guest feedback, and other key updates.     Languages     Fluency in English is essential.  Additional language skills, particularly those relevant to the hotel's location or clientele, are a significant advantage.

Pasona đang tìm vị trí AP Accountant & Admin (10-18M), kí hợp đồng với Pasona, làm việc tại công ty đối tác, thông tin như sau:      Mô tả công việc    I. AP Accountant (02-07/2025)    - Thu thập và kiểm tra hóa đơn nhà cung cấp, chi phí và các chứng từ khác,    nhập liệu vào SAP    - Duy trì hệ thống lưu trữ hồ sơ công nợ phải trả    - Thực hiện thanh toán cho nhà cung cấp, thuế, hải quan    - Đối chiếu tất cả các tài khoản phải trả (AP)    - Kiểm tra các yêu cầu bồi hoàn (yêu cầu chi phí cá nhân, chi phí kinh doanh) và thực hiện hoàn tiền    - Cập nhật, tính toán thiết bị, phân bổ thiết bị demo, khấu hao tài sản, chi phí trả trước    - Kiểm tra tất cả các chi phí nhập khẩu và phân bổ vào giá vốn hàng bán    - Đối chiếu ngân hàng và tiền mặt, dự báo dòng tiền    - Kê khai thuế hàng tháng, quý, năm (VAT, FCT, CIT) và các vấn đề thuế khác    - Làm việc với cơ quan thuế, kiểm toán, ngân hàng    - Xử lý các vấn đề kế toán tổng hợp khác, đóng sổ báo cáo hàng tháng, hàng năm    - Các nhiệm vụ khác được giao       II. HR & Admin (08/2025 - 01/2026)    - Ghi nhận ngày phép, thêm giờ và lên bảng chấm công, lên bảng lương & gửi    phiếu lương hàng tháng    - BHXH: Báo tăng, giảm, làm chế độ BHXH cho nhân viên, chốt sổ    - Thuế: Đăng ký mã số thuế, đăng ký người phụ thuộc, cập nhật thông tin thuế, phát hành chứng từ khấu trừ thuế (nếu có)    - Theo dõi HDLD, tái ký HDLD, phụ lục hợp đồng, quyết định nhân sự, chấm dứt HDLD,…    - Tuyển dụng, các báo cáo nhân sự liên quan    - Làm việc với các nhà cung cấp, quản lý tòa nhà, đặt hàng và mua sắm các    thiết bị văn phòng (trang thiết bị kỹ thuật, thiết bị văn phòng, giải trí, văn phòng phẩm..)    - Kiểm tra chi phí, lấy hoá đơn từ nhà cung cấp    - Sắp xếp các hợp đồng, tài liệu của Admin & HR    - Tổ chức sự kiện: Tiệc cuối năm, Sinh nhật nhân viên ,...    - Quản lý thiết bị, đồ dùng Công ty    - Thư ký cuộc họp (1 lần/tháng)    - Các công việc khác được giao       Yêu cầu    - Chứng chỉ hoặc bằng cấp trong lĩnh vực kế toán, có kiến thức tốt về kế toán tài chính    - Welcome fresher, có kinh nghiệm intership liên quan là điểm cộng    - Kinh nghiệm: không kinh nghiệm cho tới dưới 5 năm kinh nghiệm    - Nhanh nhẹn    - Tiếng Anh tốt, cả nói và viết    - Duy trì mối quan hệ hỗ trợ với các phòng ban Tài chính và các phòng ban chức năng khác       • Tùy theo mong muốn Ứng viên kí hợp đồng 6 tháng (AP Accountant) hoặc 1 năm (AP Accountant & Admin)       Phúc lợi    - Mức lương: 10-18M VND (Gross)    - Không thử việc    - BHXH full lương    - Gói khám sức khoẻ cao cấp    - Thời gian làm việc: 8h-17h, T2-T6 (Nghỉ T7, CN)   - Địa điểm làm việc: Cầu Giấy, Hà Nội

Kế toán Ngân hàng    đóng vai trò quan trọng, đảm bảo việc quản lý hiệu quả các giao dịch tài chính, thanh toán và tín dụng của doanh nghiệp. Bạn sẽ chịu trách nhiệm lập hồ sơ tín dụng, thực hiện thanh toán, đối chiếu số liệu, và báo cáo tài chính liên quan đến ngân hàng. Đây là cơ hội để bạn phát triển kỹ năng chuyên môn trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp và đóng góp vào sự ổn định tài chính, hỗ trợ các chiến lược phát triển dài hạn của công ty.       Các trách nhiệm chính của vị trí này bao gồm:    1.Quản lý hồ sơ tín dụng và hạn mức ngân hàng:     Chuẩn bị và lập hồ sơ tín dụng tại các ngân hàng và tổ chức tài chính, bao gồm    Quản lý hạn mức tín dụng và theo dõi dư nợ định kỳ     2.Quản lý thanh toán ngân hàng:     Xử lý các giao dịch thanh toán qua ngân hàng    Rà soát, đối chiếu số liệu thanh toán     3.Hạch toán kế toán:     Lập và duyệt các bút toán liên quan đến ngân hàng    Theo dõi và lưu trữ hồ sơ     4.Báo cáo tài chính liên quan đến ngân hàng:     Lập báo cáo tài chính định kỳ    Hỗ trợ kiểm toán nội bộ và kiểm toán độc lập        CHÂN DUNG ỨNG VIÊN LÝ TƯỞNG:    1.Kiến thức và kinh nghiệm:     Trình độ: Tốt nghiệp đại học chuyên ngành Kế toán, Tài chính, Ngân hàng hoặc lĩnh vực liên quan.    Tối thiểu 2 năm kinh nghiệm tại vị trí tương tự.    Ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực F&B hoặc tài chính doanh nghiệp.    Thành thạo nghiệp vụ kế toán liên quan đến ngân hàng, tín dụng, và thanh toán.    Hiểu rõ các quy định pháp luật liên quan đến kế toán, thuế và tài chính.    Nắm vững cách sử dụng các phần mềm kế toán như SAP, MISA, hoặc các phần mềm ERP khác.     2.Kỹ năng:     Kỹ năng giao tiếp: Giao tiếp chuyên nghiệp với ngân hàng và tổ chức tài chính để thương thảo các điều kiện tín dụng (lãi suất, phí dịch vụ, kỳ hạn).    Kỹ năng phân tích số liệu và lập báo cáo tài chính.    Thành thạo Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) để phân tích dữ liệu và lập báo cáo.    Kỹ năng sử dụng các hệ thống ngân hàng trực tuyến (Internet Banking, Mobile Banking).        ỨNG TUYỂN:    Vui lòng truy cập trang web của HSHG để ứng tuyển:  https://haisanhoanggia.com/ , hoặc    Gửi CV đến địa chỉ email:  tuyendung@haisanhoanggia.com

With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.   Position Purpose   The hotel-based Accountant role is responsible for supporting the Clustering finance department in managing financial transactions, ensuring accuracy in reporting, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards. This role contributes to the overall financial health of the hotel by assisting in accounts payable and receivable, preparing financial reports, and supporting daily operations.   Duties & Key Responsibilities    Accounts Payable     Account for and audit all items on purchase orders, receiving records, suppliers’ invoices, outgoing shipments, and credit notes.  Review all payments at the property level and forward them to the Cluster Assistant Director of Finance for approval and signature.  Ensure all invoices have supporting documentation attached before approval or payment.  Balance suppliers’ monthly statements with the hotel’s accounts payable records and follow up on missing invoices or credit notes.  Ensure invoices are approved by relevant Department Heads before payment.  Properly record, reconcile, and prepare invoices for payment, ensuring correct general ledger and cost centre codes are used.  Ensure the best rates are used for foreign currency payments and maintain confidentiality of bank account details.  Maintain an up-to-date filing system and handle all requests and inquiries in a timely and friendly manner.      Cost Management     Ensure security of all stores and proper access restrictions.  Verify that all incoming goods are received via the Receiving Area and checked against purchase orders.  Record and verify food and beverage invoices for accuracy against approved market prices. Conduct regular inspections of storerooms and receiving areas to ensure compliance with standards.  Maintain knowledge of the hotel’s inventory system and assist in training users on its operation.  Monitor stock levels and conduct monthly stock takes, ensuring accurate records of inventory receipts and issues.  Collaborate with the Cluster Purchasing Manager and department heads to minimize costs without sacrificing quality.      Income Audit     Collect all F&B bills and Front Office folio with supporting bills, ascertaining that the totals shown in agreement with trial balance reports.  Audit guest ledgers and all entertainment checks for propriety and authorization, then forward to Cluster Senior Accountant (IA) for review and approval, carrying out the same procedures for house use checks.  Maintain control record of Cashiers’ over / short and investigate major discrepancies and prepare monthly summary for approval, reporting material shortage immediately.  Check all void checks and prepare void list reports (F&B).  Control all coupons issued in regard to promotions, including group meals, in coordination with the Senior Accountant.      General Cashier Duties     Collect and count (with a witness from the Operations department) the contents of all cashiers’ envelopes on a daily basis.  Include all money orders in the daily deposit to the bank.  Prepare General Cashier’s Daily Report.  Provide all cashiers with change as required.  Reimburse cashiers for any disbursements / due backs made by them.  Properly account for all disbursements made from the General Cashier’s float.  Ensure that all cashiers and witness drop is properly noted in the drop log, highlighting any deviation.  Ensure that adequate security measures are in place in the transferring of funds to or from the hotel.  Provide clear instructions to cashiers on how to handle their funds and secure them from loss.  Ensure that the physical house funds in agreement with the house fund’s general ledger account and is reconciled on a monthly basis.  Bring any discrepancies or irregularities to the attention of the Cluster Director of Finance.  Safeguard and secure access to the General Cashier’s float and safe at all times.  Disburse petty cash only on the presentation of a petty cash voucher approved by the Cluster Director of Finance or in his / her absence.  Properly record, reconcile and prepare for reimbursement, the petty cash imprest on a weekly basis ensuring all transactions have supporting documentation.      Accounts Receivable      Collect and reconcile credit card transactions in the trial balance report with all sales slips.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all credit card charges.  Coordinate with the banks for credit draft capture issues.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all city ledgers.      Requirements     Previous experience in accounting or finance is preferred.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Qualifications     A bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent qualification preferred      Work Locations   Tru by Hilton Viet Tri City Centre   Schedule   Full-time   Brand   Tru by Hilton   Job   Accounting

Responsibilities   Document and Payment Verification   Receive and review payment documents from relevant departments.  Verify the legality of invoices and ensure payment documents comply with company policies, including forms, budgets, and approvals.   Transaction Recording and Data Entry   Issue receipts, payment vouchers, and sales invoices for transactions as they occur.  Enter data into the accounting software for accounts related to cash, accounts payable and receivable, inventory, revenue, expenses, etc., ensuring timely recording within the correct period.   Accounts Payable and Receivable Management   Monitor internal and external accounts payable and receivable with customers and suppliers.  Prepare monthly or on-request reports, conducting monthly, quarterly, and annual reconciliations.   Tax Filing and Reporting   Prepare and submit VAT, PIT, CIT declarations, usage reports, and other applicable tax filings.  Ensure timely submission of all tax declarations and reports as required by law.   Expense Allocation   Allocate prepaid expenses, tools, equipment, and fixed assets according to accounting standards.   Document Review and Reconciliation   Review and verify all supporting documents and invoices to ensure accuracy in tax declarations.  Reconcile detailed and summary accounts to ensure accuracy and compliance.   Profit and Loss Transfer   Perform carry-forward entries of unallocated profits from the previous year.  Record current year profit and loss to accurately reflect the financial position.   Financial Reporting   Prepare financial statements, including the balance sheet, income statement, cash flow statement, and financial report notes.   Annual Licensing and Tax Submission   Submit annual business license tax filings by the 31st of January each year.  Submit financial statements and tax documents in compliance with current legal regulations.        Qualifications    Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field.  2+ years of experience in general accounting, with a strong understanding of tax filing and financial reporting.  Strong knowledge of accounting principles, local tax laws, and financial regulations.  Proficiency in accounting software and ERP, Quickbooks   Attention to detail and accuracy, with excellent analytical and organizational skills.  Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and manage multiple tasks.   Chinese language is more priority.

1. Administrative tasks:   - Manage monthly expenses, prepare payment documentation and request.  - Manage the delivery and receipt of documents, letters, official correspondence, and phone calls for the company.  - Manage, monitor, and provide timely updates on the quantity, status, and value of company assets.  - Coordinate maintenance and repair services, as well as regular office cleaning.  - Handle the requisition/proposal for purchasing company assets and office supplies.  - Ensure that documents and records are checked and stored correctly and in full accordance with regulations.  - Monitor and manage weekly lunch orders and office beverages.  - Manage the monthly vehicle registration list for employees.  - Support in scheduling meeting rooms and appointments for the company.  - Receive and process business trip requests, including booking flights and accommodations for employees.   - Ensure the smooth operation of the office building and handle general administrative tasks of the office.       2. Our offers   - A competitive remuneration package with great benefits to retain our talents  - 14 annual leaves and 12 fully-paid sick leaves per year  - Various bonus: 13th month salary, project accomplishment, public and Tet holiday, etc.  - Bao Viet private healthcare insurance, annual health check-up  - Provided lunch, coffee and other amenities at our pantry stand  - Performance review 2 times per year  - A friendly, cooperative, fast-paced yet professional working environment  - Company trip, team building, frequent internal events for employee retention

Tham gia cùng Terraverde Travel & Events – Chúng tôi đang tuyển dụng!    Vị trí:   • Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay  (Ticketing Officer)   • Kế Toán Viên (Accountant)   Địa điểm làm việc:  Sala Urban Area, An Lợi Đông Ward, Thành phố Thủ Đức, TP. Hồ Chí Minh  Terraverde Travel, một thương hiệu hàng đầu trong lĩnh vực du lịch và lữ hành, đang tìm kiếm những ứng viên tài năng, cẩn thận và có tinh thần trách nhiệm cao để gia nhập đội ngũ của chúng tôi. Chúng tôi đang tuyển dụng Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay và Kế toán viên, những người đam mê lĩnh vực dịch vụ, tài chính và kế toán, đồng thời mong muốn đóng góp vào sự thành công của một công ty năng động. Nếu bạn có sự chú ý đến từng chi tiết và sẵn sàng nâng tầm sự nghiệp của mình, chúng tôi muốn lắng nghe từ bạn.      1. Vị trí:  Chuyên viên đặt vé máy bay   Mô tả công việc:    Đặt vé máy bay theo yêu cầu của khách hàng.  Kiểm tra giá vé, điều kiện vé và thực hiện xuất/hủy/hoàn đổi vé.  Hỗ trợ tư vấn các phương án tối ưu về giá và lịch trình bay cho khách hàng.  Theo dõi và cập nhật các chính sách, quy định của hãng hàng không.  Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để đảm bảo dịch vụ tốt nhất cho khách hàng.  Xử lý các tình huống phát sinh liên quan đến vé máy bay.    Yêu cầu:    Có ít nhất 1 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực đặt vé máy bay.  Thành thạo các hệ thống đặt vé của hãng hàng không (Amadeus, Galileo, Sabre…) là 1 lợi thế. Công ty sẽ đào tạo khi cần thiết.  Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt, cẩn thận, tỉ mỉ và có tinh thần trách nhiệm cao.  Khả năng làm việc độc lập và phối hợp nhóm tốt.  Tiếng Anh đọc hiểu tốt       2. Vị trí:  Kế Toán Viên   Mô tả công việc:    Tiếp nhận, kiểm tra và xử lý các chứng từ thu – chi.  Thực hiện thu tiền từ khách hàng và nhập liệu vào hệ thống phần mềm kế toán.  Theo dõi công nợ khách hàng, nhắc nợ và đối chiếu công nợ định kỳ.  Hạch toán các nghiệp vụ kế toán liên quan đến thu – chi theo đúng quy định.  Đảm bảo số liệu kế toán chính xác, đầy đủ và kịp thời.  Hỗ trợ lập báo cáo thu – chi hàng ngày, hàng tuần và hàng tháng.  Phối hợp với các bộ phận liên quan để đảm bảo quy trình thanh toán được thực hiện nhanh chóng và chính xác.  Lưu trữ, sắp xếp chứng từ kế toán một cách khoa học, dễ tra cứu.    Yêu cầu:    Tốt nghiệp chuyên ngành Kế toán, Tài chính hoặc các ngành liên quan.  Có từ 01 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí kế toán thu hoặc kế toán thanh toán.  Thành thạo phần mềm kế toán MISA AMIS và Microsoft Office (đặc biệt là Excel).  Cẩn thận, trung thực, có trách nhiệm với công việc.  Kỹ năng làm việc nhóm và giao tiếp tốt.  Có khả năng làm việc độc lập, chịu được áp lực công việc.  Tiếng Anh đọc hiểu tốt         3. Quyền lợi:    Mức lương thỏa thuận theo năng lực  Được hưởng đầy đủ chế độ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN theo quy định của pháp luật.  Thưởng theo hiệu quả công việc và các ngày lễ, tết.  Cơ hội phát triển nghề nghiệp trong môi trường chuyên nghiệp.  Được đào tạo nâng cao nghiệp vụ      📩  Cách ứng tuyển:   Vui lòng gửi CV về email: recruit@terraverde.travel với tiêu đề  "Ứng tuyển - [Tên vị trí]" .  Hạn nộp hồ sơ: 21 / 02 / 2025  Cảm ơn và mong được chào đón bạn gia nhập đội ngũ Terraverde Travel!

With thousands of hotels in over 100 countries and territories, Hilton offers countless opportunities to delight. From an open door to a welcoming smile and an exceptional experience, we offer the millions of travellers who stay with us every year a welcome they will never forget. In addition to our flagship brand, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, the family of brands includes Waldorf Astoria, LXR, Conrad, Canopy, Curio Collection, DoubleTree, Hilton Garden Inn, Hampton and many others.  If you appreciate the impact global travel can have on the world, you may be just the person we are looking for to work as a Hilton Team Member. Because it’s with Hilton where we never forget the reason we're here: to delight our guests, Team Members, and owners alike.   Position Purpose   The hotel-based Accountant role is responsible for supporting the Clustering finance department in managing financial transactions, ensuring accuracy in reporting, and maintaining compliance with accounting standards. This role contributes to the overall financial health of the hotel by assisting in accounts payable and receivable, preparing financial reports, and supporting daily operations.   Duties & Key Responsibilities    Accounts Payable     Account for and audit all items on purchase orders, receiving records, suppliers’ invoices, outgoing shipments, and credit notes.  Review all payments at the property level and forward them to the Cluster Assistant Director of Finance for approval and signature.  Ensure all invoices have supporting documentation attached before approval or payment.  Balance suppliers’ monthly statements with the hotel’s accounts payable records and follow up on missing invoices or credit notes.  Ensure invoices are approved by relevant Department Heads before payment.  Properly record, reconcile, and prepare invoices for payment, ensuring correct general ledger and cost centre codes are used.  Ensure the best rates are used for foreign currency payments and maintain confidentiality of bank account details.  Maintain an up-to-date filing system and handle all requests and inquiries in a timely and friendly manner.      Cost Management     Ensure security of all stores and proper access restrictions.  Verify that all incoming goods are received via the Receiving Area and checked against purchase orders.  Record and verify food and beverage invoices for accuracy against approved market prices. Conduct regular inspections of storerooms and receiving areas to ensure compliance with standards.  Maintain knowledge of the hotel’s inventory system and assist in training users on its operation.  Monitor stock levels and conduct monthly stock takes, ensuring accurate records of inventory receipts and issues.  Collaborate with the Cluster Purchasing Manager and department heads to minimize costs without sacrificing quality.      Income Audit     Collect all F&B bills and Front Office folio with supporting bills, ascertaining that the totals shown in agreement with trial balance reports.  Audit guest ledgers and all entertainment checks for propriety and authorization, then forward to Cluster Senior Accountant (IA) for review and approval, carrying out the same procedures for house use checks.  Maintain control record of Cashiers’ over / short and investigate major discrepancies and prepare monthly summary for approval, reporting material shortage immediately.  Check all void checks and prepare void list reports (F&B).  Control all coupons issued in regard to promotions, including group meals, in coordination with the Senior Accountant.      General Cashier Duties     Collect and count (with a witness from the Operations department) the contents of all cashiers’ envelopes on a daily basis.  Include all money orders in the daily deposit to the bank.  Prepare General Cashier’s Daily Report.  Provide all cashiers with change as required.  Reimburse cashiers for any disbursements / due backs made by them.  Properly account for all disbursements made from the General Cashier’s float.  Ensure that all cashiers and witness drop is properly noted in the drop log, highlighting any deviation.  Ensure that adequate security measures are in place in the transferring of funds to or from the hotel.  Provide clear instructions to cashiers on how to handle their funds and secure them from loss.  Ensure that the physical house funds in agreement with the house fund’s general ledger account and is reconciled on a monthly basis.  Bring any discrepancies or irregularities to the attention of the Cluster Director of Finance.  Safeguard and secure access to the General Cashier’s float and safe at all times.  Disburse petty cash only on the presentation of a petty cash voucher approved by the Cluster Director of Finance or in his / her absence.  Properly record, reconcile and prepare for reimbursement, the petty cash imprest on a weekly basis ensuring all transactions have supporting documentation.      Accounts Receivable      Collect and reconcile credit card transactions in the trial balance report with all sales slips.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all credit card charges.  Coordinate with the banks for credit draft capture issues.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all city ledgers.      Requirements     Previous experience in accounting or finance is preferred.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Qualifications     A bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent qualification preferred      Work Locations   Tru by Hilton Hau Giang City Centre   Schedule   Full-time   Brand   Tru by Hilton   Job   Accounting

Thành lập 9/2015, ZIM là tổ chức giáo dục uy tín trong lĩnh vực đào tạo tiếng Anh và luyện thi chứng chỉ tiếng Anh, chúng tôi mang sứ mệnh phát triển trí tuệ Việt bằng việc phát triển khả năng tư duy và sử dụng ngôn ngữ toàn cầu.    Tại ZIM, để giúp từng học viên học tập ngôn ngữ Anh hiệu quả và đạt kết quả cao trong các bài thi chứng chỉ tiếng Anh, các Giảng viên trình độ chuyên môn ưu tú đã xây dựng và liên tục cập nhật hệ thống giáo trình chuyên sâu, trọng tâm và bài bản. Với hệ thống đào tạo và hỗ trợ học viên chuyên nghiệp, tập trung vào sự sự hiệu quả học tập, ZIM không chỉ đảm bảo thành công mà còn đem đến những trải nghiệm học tập tuyệt vời nhất cho học viên. Từ những giá trị đó, ZIM đồng hành cùng các thế hệ trẻ Việt Nam vươn tới những đỉnh cao trong học tập và sự nghiệp.          Vị trí:   Kế toán tiền lương (Payroll Accountant)     Công việc chính      Tính toán và xử lý tiền lương hàng tháng cho nhân viên, đảm bảo chính xác và kịp thời.    Tính toán và khấu trừ thuế TNCN, BHXH, BHYT, BHTN và các khoản khấu trừ khác, tuân thủ quy định pháp luật.    Duy trì, bảo mật và cập nhật hồ sơ tiền lương và dữ liệu nhân viên.    Phân tích dữ liệu tiền lương và đưa ra khuyến nghị cải tiến quy trình.    Thực hiện báo cáo định kỳ về lương, BHXH và thuế TNCN.    Giải đáp thắc mắc của nhân viên liên quan đến tiền lương và phúc lợi.    Phối hợp chặt chẽ với các bộ phận liên quan và cơ quan chức năng để đảm bảo tuân thủ quy định về tiền lương và thuế.      Yêu cầu      Cử nhân ngành Kế - Kiểm toán    Có ít nhất 2 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc ở vị trí Kế toán Tiền lương hoặc vị trí tương đương.    Thành thạo các phần mềm kế toán và quản lý tiền lương.    Hiểu biết về luật thuế, BHXH và các quy định liên quan.    Kỹ năng phân tích và xử lý số liệu tốt.    Kỹ năng giao tiếp và giải quyết vấn đề hiệu quả.    Chú ý đến chi tiết và khả năng làm việc dưới áp lực.      Phúc lợi      Lương cứng từ VND 14.000.000 - 25.000.000 gross/tháng    Phụ cấp ăn trưa    12 ngày phép năm, lương tháng thứ 13, Du lịch hàng năm    Review công việc theo yêu cầu    Bảo hiểm, thuế TNCN theo quy định nhà nước       Thời gian & địa điểm làm việc      Thời gian làm việc  : Thứ 2 - Thứ 6 (9h - 17h)    Địa điểm làm việc  : 38 đường B4, KDT Sala, P. An Lợi Đông, Quận 2      Quy trình phỏng vấn      Vòng 1: Sơ vấn với HR    Vòng 2: Phỏng vấn online

Verify that all incoming goods are received via the Receiving Area and checked against purchase orders.  Record and verify food and beverage invoices for accuracy against approved market prices. Conduct regular inspections of storerooms and receiving areas to ensure compliance with standards.  Maintain knowledge of the hotel’s inventory system and assist in training users on its operation.  Monitor stock levels and conduct monthly stock takes, ensuring accurate records of inventory receipts and issues.  Collaborate with the Cluster Purchasing Manager and department heads to minimize costs without sacrificing quality.      Income Audit     Collect all F&B bills and Front Office folio with supporting bills, ascertaining that the totals shown in agreement with trial balance reports.  Audit guest ledgers and all entertainment checks for propriety and authorization, then forward to Cluster Senior Accountant (IA) for review and approval, carrying out the same procedures for house use checks.  Maintain control record of Cashiers’ over / short and investigate major discrepancies and prepare monthly summary for approval, reporting material shortage immediately.  Check all void checks and prepare void list reports (F&B).  Control all coupons issued in regard to promotions, including group meals, in coordination with the Senior Accountant.      General Cashier Duties     Collect and count (with a witness from the Operations department) the contents of all cashiers’ envelopes on a daily basis.  Include all money orders in the daily deposit to the bank.  Prepare General Cashier’s Daily Report.  Provide all cashiers with change as required.  Reimburse cashiers for any disbursements / due backs made by them.  Properly account for all disbursements made from the General Cashier’s float.  Ensure that all cashiers and witness drop is properly noted in the drop log, highlighting any deviation.  Ensure that adequate security measures are in place in the transferring of funds to or from the hotel.  Provide clear instructions to cashiers on how to handle their funds and secure them from loss.  Ensure that the physical house funds in agreement with the house fund’s general ledger account and is reconciled on a monthly basis.  Bring any discrepancies or irregularities to the attention of the Cluster Director of Finance.  Safeguard and secure access to the General Cashier’s float and safe at all times.  Disburse petty cash only on the presentation of a petty cash voucher approved by the Cluster Director of Finance or in his / her absence.  Properly record, reconcile and prepare for reimbursement, the petty cash imprest on a weekly basis ensuring all transactions have supporting documentation.      Accounts Receivable      Collect and reconcile credit card transactions in the trial balance report with all sales slips.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all credit card charges.  Coordinate with the banks for credit draft capture issues.  Collect up to date supporting documents for all city ledgers.      Requirements     Previous experience in accounting or finance is preferred.  Strong understanding of accounting principles and practices.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.      Qualifications     A bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field. CPA or equivalent qualification preferred      Work Locations   Tru by Hilton Da Nang City Centre   Schedule   Full-time   Brand   Tru by Hilton   Job   Accounting
