Location:  Vietnam  City:  Hanoi  Contract Type:  Staff  Grade:  X4  Salary scale:  Country Scale  Contract Duration:  12 months (possibility of extension)  Deadline:  21/02/2025  Job Reference:  RP25-26   Position Summary   To support program delivery in Vietnam, GGGI is seeking a Program Assistant to execute administrative and project-related tasks. The Program Assistant will play a critical role in ensuring the effective operation of administrative activities, including organizing events, arranging travel, managing supply chain recruitment, procurement, scheduling for the Country Representative, overseeing office assets, and other administrative services. The Program Assistant will work under the supervision of the focal point of the Operations Enabling Division (OED) and the Vietnam Country Representative, supporting Vietnam programs and collaborating with other team members in the Vietnam office.   PURPOSE   The Program Assistant will support the Vietnam Country Office, ensuring smooth daily operations. This role involves managing administrative tasks, organizing schedules, and assisting with relevant operational assignments as needed.   ENGAGEMENT   Under The Guidance Of The Country Representative And OED Focal Point, The Program Assistant Will Perform The Following Tasks Related To GGGI's Country Programs In Vietnam    Administrative Support: Manage calendars, schedule meetings, and coordinate travel arrangements for the Country Representative and project teams.  Project Coordination: Assist with ongoing projects, track progress, and follow up on deadlines.     DELIVERY    Administrative Support   Key responsibilities include, but are not limited to:    Organize meetings and provide logistical support, including scheduling and documentation.  Monitor and maintain office supplies and assets, ensuring appropriate use and updating inventory and asset records.  Support financial functions, including managing the office budget, expense tracking, and petty cash reconciliation.  Coordinate logistical arrangements for GGGI events and workshops, acting as the main coordinator for event delivery.  Prepare for staff onboarding processes, including visa processing, work permit exemptions, and temporary resident cards for international experts in GGGI Vietnam.     Project Coordination Support     Assist with implementing project procedures and tools to ensure smooth transactions and output delivery.  Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, reports, and meeting notes.     Other Tasks     Perform any additional duties assigned by the Country Representative or Project Manager.     Requirements   QUALIFICATIONS    Undergraduate degree.  At least 1 year of professional experience in administration, logistics, or procurement (preferred).  Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools and applications.  Fluent in English and Vietnamese (both written and spoken).  Self-motivated, detail-oriented, with strong organizational skills.    FUNCTIONAL    Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.  Ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively.  Experience working in an international/multicultural environment.  Proficiency in office software (e.g., Microsoft Office, Google Suite).  Previous administrative or assistant experience preferred.    CORPORATE    Ability to process and share information effectively and solve problems proactively.  Manage emotions and stress positively, build rapport, and resolve conflicts with ease.  Promote creativity and innovation within the team.  Work effectively with diverse teams, both culturally and professionally.      Child protection – GGGI is committed to child protection, irrespective of whether any specific area of work involves direct contact with children. GGGI’s Child Protection Policy is written in accordance with the Convention on the Rights of the Child.

Giới thiệu FiinGroup và bộ phận Financial Information   Được thành lập từ năm 2008, FiinGroup tự hào là đơn vị dẫn đầu trong mảng cung cấp dịch vụ thông tin tài chính, thông tin doanh nghiệp, thông tin thị trường và xếp hạng tín nghiệm thông qua các sản phẩm công nghệ. Chúng tôi tự hào là một doanh nghiệp FDI với các đối tác chiến lược nổi tiếng toàn cầu như bao gồm Nikkei (công ty mẹ của Financial Times), QUICK, Ngân hàng Phát triển Châu Á ADB và gần đây nhất là S&P Global Ratings – đơn vị Xếp hạng Tín nhiệm số 1 thế giới. Đồng hành cùng FiinGroup đồng nghĩa bạn được làm việc trong môi trường năng động, trẻ trung, chuyên nghiệp và luôn thay đổi không ngừng để tạo ra những chuẩn mực mới trong ngành.  Financial Information là một bộ phận kinh doanh quan trọng của FiinGroup, khối Dịch Vụ Thông Tin Tài Chính đã xây dựng nhiều nền tảng dữ liệu và phân tích khác nhau dựa trên cơ sở dữ liệu tài chính hàng đầu, toàn diện, chính xác bao gồm cổ phiếu, trái phiếu, các ngành công nghiệp, IPO, M & A và kinh tế vĩ mô.   Mô tả công việc     Tiếp nhận và phân tích yêu cầu từ các bên liên quan.  Xác định và làm rõ các yêu cầu nghiệp vụ, chức năng của sản phẩm.  Đảm bảo rằng các yêu cầu được ghi chép đầy đủ, rõ ràng, và chính xác.  Đề xuất các giải pháp tối ưu cho các yêu cầu nghiệp vụ.  Hỗ trợ việc thiết kế mô hình dữ liệu, wireframe, và prototype.  Phối hợp với đội phát triển để chuyển đổi các yêu cầu nghiệp vụ thành yêu cầu kỹ thuật.  Xây dựng và quản lý các tài liệu yêu cầu, tài liệu thiết kế và hướng dẫn sử dụng.  Đảm bảo tất cả các tài liệu được cập nhật kịp thời và dễ dàng truy cập.  Làm cầu nối giữa các bên liên quan và đội phát triển.  Đảm bảo các yêu cầu và mục tiêu của sản phẩm được hiểu rõ và thống nhất giữa các bên.  Tham gia vào việc kiểm thử sản phẩm để đảm bảo sản phẩm đáp ứng đúng yêu cầu đã đề ra.  Đánh giá các kết quả phát triển sản phẩm và phản hồi về chất lượng sản phẩm.     Yêu Cầu     Tốt nghiệp đại học trở lên trong các ngành Kinh tế, Tài chính, Công Nghệ Thông Tin. Ưu tiên ứng viên đặt CFA level 1 trở lên.  Ít nhất 2 năm kinh nghiệm ở vị trí Business Analyst, ưu tiên ứng viên có kinh nghiệm làm việc trong lĩnh vực phát triển sản phẩm, đặc biệt tài chính chứng khoán.  Hiểu biết sâu rộng về quy trình phát triển phần mềm và các phương pháp Agile, Scrum.  Sử dụng thành thạo các công cụ Tableau, PowerBI.  Khả năng làm việc với cơ sở dữ liệu và SQL: Có khả năng sử dụng SQL để kiểm tra dữ liệu, xác nhận các yêu cầu và hỗ trợ đội phát triển trong việc thiết kế hệ thống.  Tiếng Anh giao tiếp tốt     Chế Độ     Thu nhập hàng tháng: Theo năng lực, có thể thỏa thuận. Tháng lương 13.  Thưởng năm theo năng lực, thưởng dự án và các mức thưởng khác theo Quy chế Thu nhập.  Các khoản phúc lợi: Thưởng Lễ, Tết, … bằng tiền theo Thỏa ước Lao động tập thể.  Chính sách BHXH, BHYT, BHTN, KPCĐ và các phúc lợi khác theo đúng quy định của Luật lao động và của Công ty.  14-16 ngày phép/ năm so với trung bình 12 ngày phép/năm trên thị trường.  Đối với Senior trở lên: Được đóng bảo hiểm Y tế của Bảo Hiểm PVI  Cơ hội thăng tiến sớm cho cá nhân tiêu biểu.  Khung giờ làm việc linh hoạt.  Trợ cấp các loại tuỳ theo đối tượng: phụ cấp điện thoại, phụ cấp gửi xe ô tô, trợ cấp kết hôn.    Gửi CV Email liên hệ: Talents@fiingroup.vn

Strategic Executive Assistant     1. Position Overview     We are seeking a Strategic Executive Assistant (EA) to provide high-level support to senior leadership in schedule optimization, workflow coordination, information management, and team development.      This role extends beyond traditional administrative functions, requiring strategic acumen, project coordination expertise, internal relationship management, and decision-making support. The ideal candidate will possess agility, resourcefulness, and resilience to thrive in a dynamic, high-pressure environment. Additionally, a high degree of emotional intelligence (EQ) is essential to foster effective interactions, manage communications, and create a positive organizational culture.      2. Key Responsibilities     A. Executive Schedule & Workflow Management  	•	Develop and manage the executive’s business schedule, travel logistics, and key eng agements. 	•	Organize meetings and events, ensuring optimal scheduling and conflict resolution.  	•	Track key initiatives, follow up on action items, and prioritize tasks effectively.  	•	Act as the primary liaison between the executive and internal/external stakeholders.     B. Internal Communication & Relationship Management  	•	Serve as a strategic communication bridge, ensuring seamless information flow within the organization.  	•	Maintain a constructive and high-performance work environment by mitigating potential conflicts.  	•	Monitor team morale, providing insights and recommendations to leadership.  	•	Facilitate structured communication between leadership and direct reports to ensure clarity and alignment.      C. Organizational Strategy & Talent Development Support  	•	Consolidate and analyze team performance data to support strategic decisio n-making. 	•	Assist in the execution of employee development programs and organizational optimizations.  	•	Collaborate cross-functionally to drive key strategic initiatives.  	•	Monitor KPIs related to team effectiveness, identifying opportunities for improvement.     D. Adaptive Problem-Solving & High-Pressure Support  	•	Proactively address and resolve unforeseen scheduling, operational, or personnel challenges.  	•	Adapt swiftly to dynamic changes, providing real-time decision-making support.  	•	Ensure operational continuity and crisis management in high-intensity situations.      3. Core Competencies & Attributes      ✅  Strategic Thinking & Execution:  Ability to understand business priorities and coordinate high-level initiatives.  ✅  High Emotional Intelligence (EQ):  Adept at managing communication flow and navigating internal relationships.  ✅  Agility, Resilience & Problem-Solving:  Thrives under pressure, proactively manages challenges, and adapts to changing demands.  ✅  Proactiveness & Independence:  Demonstrates a solutions-oriented mindset, anticipating needs before they arise.  ✅  Data Analysis & Decision Support:  Synthesizes information into actionable insights for executive decision-making.      4. Company Description    Saigon Social  is a food and drink experience and travel agency in Vietnam, curated by acclaimed food and drink writer  Jovel Chan . From  artisanal fish sauce  to  rice wine  and the country’s  first-of-its-kind Vietnamese craft liquor tasting , Saigon Social goes beyond the usual street food crawl to uncover the craftsmanship, history, and culture behind Vietnam’s most iconic flavours, dishes and ingredients.      Whether you're a curious traveller, a discerning foodie, or a hospitality professional, our one-of-a-kind experiences are designed to be immersive, intimate, and led by passionate tastemakers. This isn’t just a food tour—it’s an invitation to go deep.      Role Description   We’re looking for a highly organized and detail-oriented  Operations Assistant  to help manage the logistics and execution of our food and drink experiences. This role is ideal for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, loves food and culture, and has strong problem-solving skills.     Key Responsibilities     Tour & Experience Coordination:  Assist in scheduling and managing bookings, ensuring smooth execution of experiences.   Guest Communication:  Handle inquiries, confirmations, and special requests before and after tours.   Logistics & Vendor Liaison:  Work with guides, restaurants, bars, and artisans to coordinate schedules and ensure seamless experiences.   On-the-Ground Support:  Be present at key events and tours to assist with setup, guest needs, and troubleshooting.   Admin & Reporting:  Maintain records, manage payments, and track performance metrics for continuous improvement.      Qualifications   Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.  Excellent communication skills in  English and Vietnamese .  Experience in hospitality, tourism, or event coordination is a plus.  Passion for food, drink, and Vietnamese culture.  Ability to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends when needed.      Why Join Us?   Work in a dynamic, fast-growing company at the forefront of Vietnam’s food scene.  Get hands-on experience in curating and executing unique culinary experiences.  Collaborate with top chefs, bartenders, and artisans for one-of-a-kind events       How to Apply:   Send your resume and a short cover letter to jovel@jovelchan.com. Tell us why you’re excited about this role and what makes you a great fit!

Position: Enrollment Specialist at 160 Driving Academy  Company: 160 Driving Academy  Location: San Bernardino, CA  Salary: $20 + commission  Hours: 7:30 AM - 4 PM  Are you ready to make money while building a career in a dynamic, fast-paced environment? As an Enrollment Specialist at 160 Driving Academy, you’ll work closely with a Business Development Specialist(BDS) to help drive enrollments and keep the branch running smoothly. This role offers a base salary plus commission, making it the perfect fit for someone motivated by results and career growth. 160 Driving Academy is the nation’s largest CDL training provider and one of the fastest-growing vocational schools. With over 145 schools built in the last decade, we’re looking for talented Enrollment Specialists to join our team, support branch success, and grow their careers.   What You’ll Be Doing     Support Enrollment Efforts: Work alongside the BDS to engage prospective students and guide them through the enrollment process.  Assist with Branch Operations: Handle administrative duties like enrollment paperwork, tuition payments, and maintaining accurate student records to ensure a smooth workflow.  Work as a Team: Collaborate with the BDS to achieve branch goals and help students move through the CDL training program.  Grow Your Earnings: Take advantage of a base salary plus commission structure—your hard work directly impacts your paycheck.  Contribute to Success: Play a key role in the branch’s day-to-day operations by staying organized and supporting the team.     What’s In It For You     High Earning Potential: A competitive base salary plus commission – the more you contribute, the more you earn!  Career Growth: 160 Driving Academy is committed to promoting from within, offering plenty of opportunities to advance.  Great Benefits: Enjoy health, dental, vision, 401(k), paid holidays, paid sick time, and paid time off.  Paid Training: We’ll provide all the tools and knowledge you need to succeed in this role.     Who We’re Looking For     Motivated and Results-Driven: You’re ready to work hard and maximize your earning potential.  Team-Oriented: You thrive in a collaborative environment and understand the importance of supporting team goals.  Organized and Detail-Oriented: You can handle multiple responsibilities and keep things running smoothly.  Personable and Persuasive: You enjoy connecting with people and helping them make life-changing decisions.  Tech-Savvy: Proficiency in Microsoft Office is required; experience with Salesforce is a plus.  Sales Experience: While not required, experience in sales, customer service, or administrative roles will set you up for success.    If you’re ready to earn big, grow your career, and work as part of a results-driven team, we’d love to hear from you! Join 160 Driving Academy and take the next step in your journey to success. Ready to Work Hard and Succeed? Apply today to join 160 Driving Academy as an Enrollment Specialist!  For more information email mrios@160drivingacademy.com  160 Driving Academy is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status, or any other legally protected characteristic

Job Number   2025-197A2   Application Deadline   2/28/2025   Position Start Date   3/3/2025  Position Title Secretary I (NY HELPS) Required Application Type School Related Personnel Salary/Pay Scale $32,117- $37,000 prorated to amount of service Job Description   LOCATION:  Career & Technical Education – Adult Education @ 900 Watervliet-Shaker Road   Basic Function   The work involves responsibility for independently performing complex clerical operations and administrative support tasks for a unit in a Division. Incumbents spend a substantial amount of time operating a personal computer and the rest of the time on routine administrative tasks to ensure the efficient workflow of the office. The work also involves responsibility for the entry and retrieval of information using software on a computer and using a computer to produce printed material such as letters, memoranda and forms. Incumbents work under general supervision, receiving detailed instructions only where policies have not been determined. This class differs from that of Secretary II by the increased time spent on operating software and the more limited scope of duties and decision-making responsibilities. Does related work as required.   Responsibilities     Prepares correspondence, documents, records and other written material in final or draft form using computer software from handwritten, rough drafts, marked copy, oral recordings or data from various equipment as the source material.  Transcribes correspondence from dictation equipment.  Composes and prepares correspondence on matters where policies and procedures are well defined.  Maintains and updates database/spreadsheet records on a personal computer.  Screens callers or visitors to determine the nature of the inquiry and refers to appropriate party or office and answers inquiries as appropriate.  Schedules conferences, meetings and makes travel arrangements.  Establishes and maintains confidential and general office files.  Explains established program policies and procedures to the general public/clients and obtains routine information for program purposes.  Receives, sorts and distributes incoming mail.  Checks, codes and processes requisitions, claims and bills.  Prepares and maintains financial, statistical and personnel records.  Monitors and tracks status of program activities.  Orders supplies and materials.  Collects and gathers information to be used as a basis for reports and memoranda and prepares summaries.  Transmits instructions from supervisor to staff and follows up to ensure deadlines are met.  Answers telephone and gives out information.  Good knowledge of modern office terminology, procedures, equipment and business English.  Good knowledge of the organization, functions, laws, policies and regulations, and terminology of the agency to which assigned.  Ability to handle routine administrative details independently.  Ability to operate a personal computer and utilize common office software programs including word processing, spreadsheet and databases at an acceptable rate of accuracy and speed.  Ability to prepare and maintain program records and routine reports.  Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.  Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with others.  Ability to organize and maintain office files.  Ability to collect information from various sources for program operations.  Physical condition commensurate with the demands of the position.    Civil Service Title Secretary I Job Qualifications    Graduation from a regionally accredited college or university or one accredited by the New York State Board of Regents to grant degrees with an Associate’s degree in secretarial science or a closely related field and one (1) year of clerical experience which involved the operation of a computer for word-processing, database or spreadsheet applications; OR,  Graduation from high school or possession of a high school equivalency diploma and three (3) years of experience as defined in (A)     PROMOTIONAL : Twelve (12) months’ permanent competitive status as a Senior Typist or Senior Keyboard Specialist.   The selected applicant will be subject to a fingerprint supported criminal history background check in accordance with SAVE Legislation effective July 1, 2001.      Candidates will not have to take an exam for this title   . This is a NY HELPS (Hiring Emergency Limited Placement Statewide) Program designated title. NY HELPS is a temporary program designed to help local government employers address current staffing issues. Traditionally, the titles filled under the NY HELPS Program required job candidates to compete in a competitive exam to be considered for employment. For the duration of the program, this title will be classified as non-competitive and categorized as a HELPS Program position. At the close of the program, this position will revert to competitive class status. Employees occupying positions filled through the HELPS Program will be granted competitive class status without the need to participate in a competitive exam.    Job Category Professional/Administrative Positions Job Location Capital District Region  Additional Information

Job Description   The Receptionist cum Admin plays a key role in creating a welcoming and professional environment for all visitors, clients, and employees. This role is responsible for managing front desk operations while providing administrative support to ensure smooth office functionality.     Reception Duties:  Greet and welcome guests promptly with a positive and helpful attitude.  Direct visitors to the appropriate person or department.  Answer, screen, and forward incoming phone calls efficiently.  Provide basic and accurate information in person, via phone, and through emails.  Maintain the reception area to be tidy, presentable, and well-stocked with necessary materials (e.g., brochures, stationery).   Administrative Support:  Receive, sort, and distribute daily mail, packages, and deliveries.  Manage office security by following safety procedures and controlling access through the reception desk.  Coordinate with building management for necessary office service registrations and maintenance requests.  Register and manage employee parking cards and office access cards.   Employee Support:  Order, manage, and maintain an inventory of office supplies to ensure stock availability.  Oversee the general upkeep of the office environment and arrange for necessary repairs and maintenance.   Travel & Event Coordination:  Work with travel agencies to organize transportation and accommodation arrangements for business travel requests.  Provide administrative support in planning and coordinating company events, meetings, and activities.   Other Responsibilities:  Complete other ad-hoc tasks as assigned by the manager.  Continuously seek ways to improve administrative processes for greater efficiency.     Requirements     Fresh graduates or those having less than one year of experience in a similar receptionist or administrative role.  Strong communication and interpersonal skills.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).  Professional appearance and behavior.  Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time effectively.  Strong organizational skills with attention to detail.

I. Mục đích của vị trí    Trợ lý BOD chịu trách nhiệm làm việc và báo cáo trực tiếp cho BOD. Đây là vị trí đóng vai trò hỗ trợ quan trọng trong việc quản lý hoạt động vận hành chung của công ty; thay mặt BOD xử lý các hạng mục công việc trong phạm vi quyền hạn. Vị trí này đòi hỏi kỹ năng tổ chức xuất sắc, sự chú ý đến chi tiết và khả năng quản lý nhiều nhiệm vụ đa dạng trong các phòng ban. Trợ lý BOD sẽ làm việc chặt chẽ với các đơn vị nội bộ và các bên liên quan bên ngoài đảm bảo hoạt động vận hành chung được thuận lợi, kịp thời xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh.       II. Phạm vi trách nhiệm - nhiệm vụ    1. Quản lý vận hành hệ thống kinh doanh của công ty     Kiểm soát hoạt động vận hành và xử lý các vấn đề phát sinh hằng ngày trên hệ thống kinh doanh.     Theo dõi kết quả, lập báo cáo, tổng hợp thông tin theo yêu cầu của BOD.    Đầu mối làm việc với các bên liên quan trong nội bộ công ty về sản xuất kinh doanh.    Thay mặt BOD xử lý các tình huống khẩn cấp khi BOD vắng mặt.     2. Chủ trì xét duyệt kế hoạch, hỗ trợ triển khai các hạng mục công việc phòng Hành chính nhân sự:   Hành chính, Tuyển dụng, Truyền thông nội bộ…    3. Xử lý công việc Hành chính của BOD:   Công tác, thanh toán hóa đơn, chuẩn bị hồ sơ tài liệu, báo cáo…    4. Quản lý quy trình và nguồn lực:     Tham vấn cho BOD các vấn đề về phát triển tổ chức, xây dựng quy chế, quy trình, chính sách nội bộ, điều phối nguồn lực…     Kiểm soát quy trình sản xuất tài nguyên nội bộ.    Quản lý hệ thống tool nội bộ của công ty.     5. Quản lý dự án    6. Các công việc khác theo chỉ đạo của BOD       III. Yêu cầu công việc     Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên các ngành Kinh tế, Tài chính, Marketing, Quản trị kinh doanh, Nhân sự, Luật,… hoặc tương đương.    Có kinh nghiệm từ 1 năm trở lên tại các vị trí Thư ký, Trợ lý, Kiểm soát nội bộ, Vận hành… hoặc tương đương.    Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm MS Office, Google Suite. Có thể sử dụng Google Data Studio, Power BI là 1 điểm cộng.    Ưu tiên: Có kinh nghiệm sử dụng/Sử dụng tốt các công cụ A.I hỗ trợ công việc.    Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt.    Kỹ năng tổng hợp báo cáo, phân tích & đánh giá.    Kỹ năng đàm phán và giải quyết vấn đề.    Khả năng làm việc đa nhiệm, quản lý thời gian, lập kế hoạch tốt.    Tiếng Anh tốt (IELTS 6.5 trở lên hoặc tương đương).    Sẵn sàng làm việc ngoài giờ, đi công tác tần suất thấp.        IV. Quyền lợi     Mức lương khởi điểm: 12.000.000 VNĐ - 18.000.000 VNĐ/tháng.     Phụ cấp ăn trưa: 900.000 VNĐ/tháng.    Review lương 2 lần/năm, thưởng các dịp lễ, Tết,...     Hưởng các quyền lợi theo quy định của Nhà nước (đóng BHYT, BHXH, BHTN).    Được hưởng các chế độ phúc lợi theo quy định công ty: sinh nhật, ốm đau, hiếu hỉ.    Nghỉ phép 12 ngày/năm, lễ, Tết theo quy định Nhà nước.    Được tham gia các hoạt động team building hàng năm.    Môi trường làm việc trẻ trung, văn hóa cởi mở, thoải mái, chuyên nghiệp trong công việc.        V. At JLL, we put client satisfaction at the front and center of everything we do. If you share our values, we will be more than happy to work with you. In this role, you’ll be responsible for working closely with clients and suppliers onsite to identify their facility-related enquiries and requirements. Your planning and budgeting skills will also be vital to the job, as you’ll take part in the procurement of vendors and services from time to time.  Making everyone safe and risk-free  Do you value workplace safety? If so, you’ll be a perfect fit for the job. In this role, you will ensure everyone’s health and safety by keeping safe workplace procedures in place and order. You’ll also be expected to carry out these procedures, as needed.  At the same time, this role puts you on the first line of defense against risks. As such, you will help implement and manage risk management programs, disaster recovery and business continuity plans. You’ll also be expected to follow escalation and incident reporting procedures and comply with the firm’s guidelines and strategies.  Sound like you? To apply, you need to be a   Qualification     College or bachelor’s degree  Have at least 02 years’ experience for admin position  Communicate in English fluently  Good computer skills such as MS Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, etc.)  Able to work under pressure or working with multi tasks at the same time  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills  Ability to work independently and as part of a team  Problem solving & negotiation skills  Experience with office management software is a plus     Passion for service   Do you have a prior experience in facilities, property management, hospitality or other related fields? Do you have an understanding of local occupational health and safety requirements, critical facilities and vendor management? Are you knowledgeable in various property systems? You are what we’re looking for!  Team player  JLL’s unmatched excellence is only made possible by team work—a core value we want you to possess. As the facilities coordinator, we expect you to support the team and work well with others toward achieving targets. Likewise, you must have a proven track record of flawless project execution, all while following company standards and procedures. Ensuring that the team practices our ‘I am JLL’ core behaviors is also under your mandate.  Client focused enthusiast  It is important that you can easily interact with the general client staff and vendors to deliver efficient services. We’ll also count on you to address conflicts and conflicting priorities effectively. Likewise, you must be an excellent and resilient communicator who faces customers with a smile at all times, even when times get rough occasionally.

Organization- Park Hyatt Phu Quoc    Summary   Provides administrative support to Executive Chef; ensures the implementation of hotel policies, standards, and procedures as they apply to the administrative functions.  Locates and attaches appropriate file correspondence to be answered by Executive Chef.  Types, files, and upkeeps all private and confidential matters related to the department.  Sets up a systematic and efficient filing system, both for hardcopies as well as all electronic data, that enables quick retrieval; ensures all files are kept up-to-date at all times.  Prepares the relevant materials for all meetings attended by Executive Chef: Daily Operations Meeting, Executive Committee Meetings, Departmental Meetings and ad hoc meetings.  Answers telephone and gives information to callers or routes call to appropriate official and places outgoing calls.  Makes copies of correspondence or other printed matters.  Prepares outgoing mail.  Types, takes dictation and minutes, draft letters, files and traces and composes correspondence.  Monitors and maintains the proper appearance of the office area.  Reads and routes incoming mail and outgoing correspondences.  Handles outgoing mails by courier.  Ensures travel authorization forms are fully completed and signed by the respective executive before handing over to the Director of Finance for signature.  Handles monthly requisition of stationeries/general and dry goods stores.  Checks and updates employees’ attendance records for Division Heads approval and obtain individual employee’ s signature before forwarding it to Human Resources/Accounting.   Qualifications   Minimum requirements  3 years of experience in the same position  Pre-opening experience is preferable  Luxury background in resort and urban city  Excellent communication skills in both spoken and written English

Location: Da Nang, Da Nang, Vietnam Department: People & Operations Posted Date: 2/4/2025  JOB DESCRIPTIOM    Manage the office, track assets, and procure equipment  Handle payments related to office operations  Research, monitor, purchase, and manage apartments (payments, temporary residence registration, etc.)  Procure office supplies and equipment upon request  Support both international and domestic business operations: booking flight tickets, business health insurance, hotel reservations, visa assistance, etc.  Manage company phone calls, mail, and incoming/outgoing documents  Support HR tasks (recruitment, onboarding new employees, etc.) and perform other professional tasks as required     Requirements     Graduated from college or higher, preferably with at least 6 months of experience in a similar position  Basic Microsoft skills, and records management skills  Careful, detail-oriented, proactive, and responsible in work  Ability to work under high pressure  Experience in related positions and knowledge of labor laws is an advantage  Good communication skills  Having English and Chinese is a plus    WORK LOCATION  2F Vinh Trung Plaza, No. 255-257 Hung Vuong, Vinh Trung, Thanh Khe, Da Nang   Benefits     5-day workweek, off Saturday & Sunday  Young & vibrant working environment with great career development opportunities  Social insurance, medical insurance, and unemployment insurance are based on actual salary  Review performance to adjust salary twice a year  Regular team building events & internal activities (weekly happy hour, quarterly team building events, Lunar New Year parties, etc.)    Any personal data you share with us during the application process will be processed strictly in compliance with applicable data protection laws and our Privacy Notice.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:    Phân tích dữ liệu, phân tích các chỉ số rủi ro, phân tích danh mục tín dụng  Xử lý dữ liệu thô và tham gia các dự án làm sạch dữ liệu, phối hợp với các phòng ban liên quan để quản lý dữ liệu  Xây dựng công cụ nhận diện đo lường rủi ro tín dụng và các ngưỡng cảnh báo sớm  Xây dựng hệ thống chỉ tiêu đo lường, thiết lập các hạn mức rủi ro để kiểm soát rủi ro tín dụng (chất lượng tín dụng, mức độ tập trung, cơ cấu danh mục tín dụng...)  Thực hiện Báo cáo phân tích danh mục tín dụng, nhận diện và đề xuất các giải pháp quản lý, điều chỉnh danh mục nhằm nâng cao hiệu quả và kiểm soát rủi ro phù hợp với khẩu vị rủi ro của công ty  Tự động hoá các báo cáo ngày/tháng/quý  Nghiên cứu, xây dựng mô hình xếp hạng điểm tín dụng và backtest kết quả thử nghiệm để áp dụng vào mô hình kinh doanh  Làm việc với các đối tác Credit Scoring  Nghiên cứu và thiết lập Risk Model theo chiến lược kinh doanh       JOB REQUIREMENTS   Yêu cầu cơ bản:  - Ngôn ngữ: Good in English (Listening – Speaking – Reading – Writing)  Trình độ chuyên môn:  Trình độ học vấn: Ưu tiên từ Đại học trở lên  Kinh nghiệm:  - Có ít nhất 03 năm kinh nghiệm làm việc tại các Ngân hàng thương mại, tổ chức tài chính, công ty kiểm toán trong các lĩnh vực: phân tích dữ liệu, quản lý rủi ro tín dụng  - Thành thạo tin học văn phòng và các công cụ phân tích dữ liệu: Excel, SQL, Power BI, Python,...  - Am hiểu thị trường cho vay cá nhân (tiêu dùng, cầm cố, tín chấp)   - Có khả năng nghiên cứu độc lập cũng như làm việc theo nhóm  - Kỹ năng tổng hợp phục vụ mục đích phân tích, quản lý và giám sát danh mục tín dụng. Ưu tiên các ứng viên có hiểu biết về thẩm quyền tín dụng, phân loại nợ, trích lập dự phòng và thu hồi nợ, hệ thống cảnh báo sớm rủi ro tại các NHTM trong và ngoài nước;      BENEFITS    Tăng lương hàng năm theo đánh giá thành tích OKR  Tháng lương 13 theo chính sách công ty  12 ngày nghỉ phép một năm  Hỗ trợ tiền ăn trưa, 880,000 VNĐ/tháng  Thưởng ngày lễ, Tết  Được cung cấp tài khoản học trực tuyển Udemy phát triển bản thân  Các chế độ nghỉ mát, tiệc cuối năm  Bảo hiểm sức khoẻ Bảo Việt   Thông tin khác:   Giờ làm việc tại trụ sở: Thứ 2 đến thứ 6 hàng tuần  Môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp, năng động tại Công ty công nghệ tài chính hàng đầu Đông Nam Á.  Cơ hội làm việc, hợp tác với các đồng nghiệp, cũng như đối tác quốc tế

Company Description    HD Capital Fund Management Joint Stock Company  is an experienced firm in fund management and financial investment in Vietnam. With strategic partnerships and a focus on growth and collaboration in the Vietnam market, we offer a dynamic business landscape for professionals to thrive.     Growing intensively in Vietnam, we are looking for a:      Investment Analyst.      The selected person will report directly to the General Manager and is responsible for daily tasks related to Investments and Portfolio Management.     His/Her main responsibilities will be:   Responsible for managing the company's investment and securities trading activities, including stocks, bonds, fund certificates, private equity investments, and other financial instruments.  Develop investment strategies, policies, and securities investment operational plans.  Conduct research and propose investment portfolios for the company.  Based on potential securities portfolio proposals, prepare investment recommendation reports for the company.  Participate in all aspects of launching new funds and managing upcoming funds, including bonds and equities.  Perform other tasks as assigned by the Board of Directors.  Specific job responsibilities will be discussed during the interview.       Qualifications    Bachelor's degree or higher in Finance, Economics, Investment or Securities, or related fields.  Experience in portfolio management and investment strategies.  Possession of a  Fund Management Practicing Certificate is a must.   Proven experience in financial analysis, business valuation, market research, and portfolio management.  Passionate and knowledgeable about the securities investment market, with strong business acumen and strategic vision.  Strong analytical skills and financial modeling expertise  Ability to work in a fast-paced financial environment      If you are interested in applying for this position, please send your CV to to anh.tran@hdcap.vn, cc long.nguyen@hdcap.vn, quoting the reference "[HDCAP-Position-Your Full Name]".     We are more than happy to receive your application!

Position Overview   As a Due Diligence Analyst, you are expected to provide support through data analysis, investigation, research and interpretation. You are expected to provide Due Diligence services by following strict rules, policies and instructions set by the client in compliance with KYC, AML Regulations, Counter-Terrorist Financing regulations, Sanctions Regulations, and Customer Due Diligence policies. You will be responsible for managing the onboarding process for new merchants or individuals, ensuring that all required documentation is collected, reviewed, and client concerns are addressed. You are also expected to contribute to the overall performance of the team by providing accurate, concise and timely reports, direct client support, and hands-on execution of these tasks. You are expected to assist the Specialist in resolving complex cases appropriate to the account assigned and deliver accurate advisement to your client, internal or external.   WHAT WILL YOU DO?    Due Diligence Support     Handles due diligence cases from Payreto Clients  Handles Know Your Customer (KYC) / Know Your Business (KYB) processes as part of the Onboarding as a Service processes.  Attends Client Inquiries in a timely manner.  Updates process guides as coordinated with the team.  Extends support to the due diligence processes of clients outsourced to Payreto.  Identifies, resolves and/or communicates issues related to applications and/or miscellaneous documentation in a timely fashion.  Performs necessary checks and identifies any potential risk / issues clients might face.     Know-Your-Customer (KYC) Checks     Carries out background checks: collecting and monitoring all relevant documents concerning the identity of the customer, as well as gaining insight into their business, ownership structure, and financial transactions for customer onboarding.  Assesses completeness and document quality prior to ensure that the documents are correct and are up to date to the commencement of the business relationship  Performs required checks (Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) and Sanctions/Adverse Media hits on individuals and entities)  Accesses public information sources such as income and asset declarations to assess the risk level of the customer to help develop a higher level of identity assurance  Verifies if there are changes in the customer’s ownership, products and services, or the business that merits     Client / Customer Engagement     Engages the client or the clients’ representative (e.g. account manager, operation specialist, process managers, etc.) to provide feedback, support, and or implementation of services outsourced to Payreto.  Participates in the clients’ internal account management calls and meetings to provide an overview of the status of processes outsourced to Payreto.  Proactively engages the client and/or client customers to provide the best customer experience possible.     Reports Generation     Generates Leadership Report ensuring proper documentation of the meetings with client, internal team updates, workload projection, and any other significant updates.  Ensures an accurate and on time delivery of offered solutions to assigned clients based on their needs.  Ensures accurate reporting of activities, opportunities, and/or challenges to the account manager assigned.     Other Tasks     Performs other official work as instructed by the immediate supervisor/manager.  Recommends and proactively implements opportunities for increased departmental efficiency.  Extends work hours when needed.  Maintains quality service by monitoring standards and/or advising Account Managers and Team leads of potential problems.     WHAT SHOULD YOU HAVE?     Bachelor's degree in Law, Business administration, Accounting, Finance or other related field.  Above average English verbal and written communication skills.  Well - versed with different Microsoft Office Tools or equivalent Google Suite tools, specifically Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets.  Must be adept in using online search engines to find relevant information.  Must have average logical and verbal reasoning.  Ability to provide correct decisions based on rules and policies.  Detail-oriented and must have strong cognitive, comprehension, and strong analytical skills.  Self-starter, driven, eager to learn and is able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.  Demonstrates ownership and accountability (can be seen by others as reliable).  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  Ability to work well under pressure with a high degree of accuracy.  Has initiative and must be flexible to adjust to the work environment and business needs.     Shift Schedule     2:00 PM - 11:00 PM (GMT +7)

Job Title   Valuation Analyst   Job Description Summary    Job Description     To undertake mortgage valuation assignments (and comercial valuation assignments if required) in Vietnam independently or as part of a team.  To take responsibility for valuation assignments and comunicate with clients (if required).  In charge of the market research of all valuation & advisory assignments across Vietnam, analyze and organize information for valuation and advisory purposes.  Writing full valuation reports and run financial calculations on property appraisal/advisory.  Making proposals and contracts as well as communicating and meeting with clients  Inspecting sites/ buildings and reviewing building information.  Build up the internal database on Viet Nam economic indicator and real estate market situation, especial for real estate market transaction database.  Ability to collaborate/team work to other departments in Company  In addition, there may be other ad-hoc projects to undertake at the Company's discretion.     Requirements     Valuation education background or minimum 1 years working experience in valuation industry if not graduated from valuation background.  Proven track record of valuation of real estate assets including mortgage and comercial assets.  Growth mindset to build business.  Familiar with the Vietnam property market.  Ability to communicate and analyze market conditions for the purpose of business development to support internal and external clients.     Skills & Knowledge     Understanding of valuation theory  Good English (both written & spoken)  Good analytical and written skills  Organizational skills including the ability to multi-task and prioritize efficiently.  Execute research initiatives    INCO: “Cushman & Wakefield”

Date: 16 Feb 2025  Type of Employment: Permanent Full Time  Location:  Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, VN Hanoi, Hanoi, VN   Title:  SR&T – Analyst (Fresh Graduates)   Are you ready to unleash your potential?   At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.  We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals. Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!   Work you’ll do     Actively participate and work with the team in client engagements.  Review financial documents and analyze financial data.  Prepare presentations and reports.  Contribute to the development of client proposals and business development activities.  Perform administrative tasks as needed to support project teams.     Your role as a leader   At Deloitte, We Believe In The Importance Of Empowering Our People To Be Leaders At All Levels. We Connect Our Purpose And Shared Values To Identify Issues As Well As To Make An Impact That Matters To Our Clients, People And The Communities. Additionally,Analystsacross Our Firm Are Expected To    Demonstrate a strong commitment to personal learning and development.  Understand how our daily work contributes to the priorities of the team and business.  Understand the set expectations and demonstrate accountability in keeping personal performance on track.  Actively focus on developing effective communications and relationship-building skills with stakeholders, clients and team.  Demonstrate an appreciation for working with others.  Understand what is fundamental to Deloitte’s success as a business.  Demonstrate integrity and an awareness of strengths, differences, and personal impact.  Develop their understanding of Deloitte and offer a fresh perspective.     Requirements     Fresh graduates with a degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Accounting, Management, Risk Management, or a related field.  Strong academic record.  Prior internship experience or coursework in audit, business strategy, finance, risk management, or related areas is a plus.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills.  Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.     Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorized Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address. Do you possess solid knowledge of alternative investments or just enthusiasm for a leading private equity and private credit consultancy firm? Consider joining  Renn Global Management LLC  based out of the USA. We are a global alternative investment manager building a next-generation asset management firm focused on the technology venture ecosystem. We provide capital solutions across venture capital, private credit and private equity asset classes. Founded on the principles of innovation, integrity, and expertise, we stand at the forefront of the industry, pioneering cutting-edge solutions that redefine traditional investment paradigms. We are transforming the landscape of asset management, propelled by a passionate commitment to shaping the future of finance.  As a Deal Sourcing Investment Associate on our fund syndication platform, you'll identify and evaluate private credit investment opportunities, managing the outbound campaign and deal pipeline effectively. This role blends the art of sales with the science of finance, offering a unique opportunity to drive our outreach and qualification processes. You'll leverage both independent research and the extensive resources of our team to uncover and initiate engagements with businesses that align with our strategic goals. With your analytical skills and financial acumen, you'll navigate market complexities, contributing to the growth of diverse investment portfolios.   Are you ready to elevate your value to new heights and redefine the future? Start your journey with team Renn today.    IN DETAIL, YOUR SUCCESS IN THIS JOB WILL BE     Effectively utilize both proprietary and external research tools to systematically identify and assess potential investment opportunities. Focus on uncovering hidden gems within the private credit and broader financial markets. Leverage your exceptional networking skills, industry events, and thorough market research to scout for the most promising opportunities;  Embark on detailed due diligence expeditions, meticulously dissecting financial statements and market trends to navigate the complex landscape of risk and opportunity with unparalleled precision across private credit markets;  Craft persuasive investment memos, masterfully weaving together market analysis and financial projections into narratives that champion our investment theses, targeting credit facilities for growth;  Disseminate compelling materials that communicate our value proposition. Initiate and manage outreach campaigns, setting up introductory calls to explore potential alignments;  Conduct preliminary assessments through video calls and networking, efficiently qualifying opportunities based on their fit with our investment criteria;  Collaborate closely with the product development team to significantly enhance platform functionality and user experience, driving innovation with your insightful and constructive feedback;  Work in perfect harmony with Investment Managers and Stakeholders, fostering effective communication and strategic alignment for our collective success in diverse investment environments;  Vigilantly monitor and support our portfolio companies, guiding them through performance tracking, strategic reviews, and milestone achievements towards sustained growth and unparalleled success, appreciating the unique dynamics of credit investments;  Continuously keep your finger on the pulse of industry trends and emerging technologies, fueling our strategies with your innovative and forward-thinking insights, ensuring we remain at the forefront of private credit markets.     What You’ll Need For Success In This Job     Hold a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Banking or a closely related field. Possession of an MBA or a relevant advanced degree will be considered an advantageous asset;  Bring at least one year of professional experience in venture capital, growth equity, investment banking, or similar fields, underscored by a profound understanding of investment methodologies and deal flow dynamics. The designated title will be assigned per your strength and experience;  Demonstrate exceptional analytical prowess, capable of executing in-depth financial analyses, market research, and comprehensive due diligence;  Exhibit outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, proven through the crafting of insightful materials and effective conversations;  Be meticulously detail-oriented, with a steadfast commitment to precision, and adept at juggling various tasks and projects without compromising quality;  Show proficiency in financial modeling, data analysis tools, and the Google Suite, enabling sophisticated analysis and efficient operation;  Embody the spirit of a self-starter with a proactive approach, continuously seeking and capitalizing on new investment opportunities with vigor;  Harbor a passionate interest in startups, technology, and innovation, coupled with a keen desire to actively contribute to the development and success of early-stage companies.     PIONEERING THE FUTURE OF INVESTMENT WITH RENN    Renn Global Management LLC  is a global alternative investment manager building a next-generation asset management firm focused on the technology venture ecosystem. We provide capital solutions across venture capital, private credit, and web3/digital asset classes. Renn Global has developed a proprietary syndication platform and investment approach that represents the future of asset management.   OUR EXPERTISE    Artificial Intelligence   From machine learning to natural language processing, we create intelligent systems that adapt, learn, and evolve.   Finance   We design and develop next-gen financial solutions, pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in digital banking, fintech, and beyond.   E-commerce   Reinventing the way we buy, sell, and exchange goods online, our e-commerce solutions are designed to deliver unparalleled user experiences and create thriving digital marketplaces.  Team Renn is a staunch advocate for equal employment opportunities. We embrace and encourage applicants from all backgrounds for every position, without considering race, color, religion, gender, age, national origin, citizenship status, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any physical or mental disability. We are dedicated to fostering a vibrant work culture that upholds diversity and inclusion, respect and integrity, a strong customer focus, and a commitment to innovation.

Participates in the clients’ internal account management calls and meetings to provide an overview of the status of processes outsourced to Payreto.  Proactively engages the client and/or client customers to provide the best customer experience possible.     Reports Generation     Generates Leadership Report ensuring proper documentation of the meetings with client, internal team updates, workload projection, and any other significant updates.  Ensures an accurate and on time delivery of offered solutions to assigned clients based on their needs.  Ensures accurate reporting of activities, opportunities, and/or challenges to the account manager assigned.     Other Tasks     Performs other official work as instructed by the immediate supervisor/manager.  Recommends and proactively implements opportunities for increased departmental efficiency.  Extends work hours when needed.  Maintains quality service by monitoring standards and/or advising Account Managers and Team leads of potential problems.     WHAT SHOULD YOU HAVE?     Bachelor's degree in Law, Business administration, Accounting, Finance or other related field.  Above average English verbal and written communication skills.  Well - versed with different Microsoft Office Tools or equivalent Google Suite tools, specifically Microsoft Excel and/or Google Sheets.  Must be adept in using online search engines to find relevant information.  Must have average logical and verbal reasoning.  Ability to provide correct decisions based on rules and policies.  Detail-oriented and must have strong cognitive, comprehension, and strong analytical skills.  Self-starter, driven, eager to learn and is able to work independently in a fast-paced environment.  Demonstrates ownership and accountability (can be seen by others as reliable).  Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.  Ability to work well under pressure with a high degree of accuracy.  Has initiative and must be flexible to adjust to the work environment and business needs.     Shift Schedule     2:00 PM - 11:00 PM (GMT +7)

About IDP   IDP is the global leader in international education services, delivering global success to students, test takers and our partners, through trusted human relationships, digital technology and customer research. An Australian-listed company, we operate in more than 50 countries around the world.  Our team is comprised of over 7,000 people of various nationalities, ages and cultural backgrounds. Proudly customer-first, our expert people are powered by global technology. Together, we offer unmatched services, helping local dreams become realities, all over the world.  Learn more at www.careers.idp.com    Role purpose    The Education Counsellor will provide excellent counselling services to guide international students to find the institution that best meets their learning and career aspirations, including providing students with the right information and advice on study opportunities and local education system, culture and geographic region, assisting with application documentation, facilitating enrolments, and promoting IDP products and services.    Key accountabilities      High Customer Service mind & pro-active sales/cross sales & follow-up to convert from potential lead source to meet the pipeline & final sales target  Counselling of prospective students and their families regarding study opportunities.  Provision of information on institutions to students either face to face or over the telephone.  Following up students’ applications and keeping students posted/ informed on offers/ rejections by the institutions.  Counselling and assistance of prospective students in entry visa application.  Accurately & timely updating of student applications on IDP Global database & team reporting scheme  Provide good after sales service to have high parent/ student referral source  Organization and implementation of promotional activities at local institutions and IDP offices.  Organization and assistance in IDP exhibitions and other educational exhibitions in the city.  Interpretation for institutions at seminars/ interviews/ exhibitions.  Maintaining a good rapport to students, their families, local and IDP institution clients and visa office.  Attending and servicing institutions upon their visits to IDP office.  Active participating in team meeting & training  Other duties as assigned by the Line Manager     Required Experience      Have 2-3 years experiences in education counselling (English course/professional course/oversea study consulting) or in banking services/insurance consulting   Prefer and have advantage if you have knowledge about oversea study consulting in Australia, US, UK, Canada or New Zealand   Excellent communication, explanation and customer orientation.   Demonstrate strong sales, have ability to maintain and widen customers’ relationship.   Ability to work under high pressure and target.   Professional & efficient business communication (both English & Vietnamese) (equivalent IELTS 6.0)   Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree.

V.I.E Assistant Relationship Manager, Vietnam - H/F    Concrètement votre quotidien ?   Au sein de CIB Global Banking à Vietnam vous serez un appui pour la couverture MNC (RNM) afin d’établir, maintenir et développer des relations mondiales avec les clients du MNC (RNM).  Au quotidien, vous exercerez des responsabilités directes :    Assister les MR RNM dans le processus KYC pour l'ouverture de nouveaux comptes, la re certification KYC en coopération avec les clients et l'équipe KYC au Vietnam et dans d'autres pays associés  Aider les MR du RNM sur d'autres travaux assignés tels que les présentations de marketing, la traduction, les réunions de clients, les événements corporatifs, les visiteurs corporatifs, les notes d'appel, la recherche prospective client/industrie/marché à utiliser par les MR pour des activités de marketing…  Soutenir les MR RNM sur la gestion des transactions bancaires quotidiennes en bonne communication avec les parties prenantes de la banque au Vietnam et dans le monde  Appuyer les MR du RNM à la conclusion d'accords de crédit et de documents connexes avec les clients, en collaboration avec la documentation et l'équipe juridique et de conformité, pour préparer, négocier des accords de crédit avec les clients et obtenir l'approbation de la banque sur les modifications au besoin  Agir en tant que MR junior pour les clients non-crédit sélectifs, tel qu’attribué par le chef de MNC     Vous aurez également pour missions :    Contribuer à assurer que toutes les transactions bancaires avec les clients sont bien gérées et en conformité avec les réglementations locales et les politiques bancaires, et les clients ont ravi l'expérience de travail avec la banque  Contribuer au développement d'entreprises avec des clients RNM      L'environnement de travail, c'est important !   Le Vietnam est l’une des économies les plus dynamiques du monde, avec de nombreuses opportunités commerciales et le développement industriel potentiel. BNP Paribas a été l 'une des premières banques internationales à établir sa présence au Vietnam en 1989 offrant une large gamme de solutions de conseil, de couverture et de financement aux entreprises et aux institutions financières. Dans ce contexte économique dynamique, vous assisterez le Responsable Territoire dans le suivi de l'activité et le soutien au développement des activités Front Office tout en promouvant les principes de la Banque, notamment par des projets transversaux et des initiatives RSE.   Et après ?   En interagissant avec différents métiers, vous pourrez:    Travailler dans un environnement dynamique et multiculturel - le personnel étant à 98% Vietnamien  Intervenir sur divers sujets et avoir une vision globale de l'entreprise  Développer la connaissance du marché et de l'activité économique vietnamiens en Asie En particulier, vous pourrez:  Développer votre capacité à diriger une réunion, un séminaire ou un comité  Développer vos compétences analytiques (analyse des revenus, coordination du processus budgétaire)  Augmenter vos connaissances techniques sur les systèmes de CRM et le suivi de l'activité commerciale      Pourquoi rejoindre BNP Paribas ?   Notre monde change : notre manière de nous informer, de consommer… et de travailler aussi ! Aujourd’hui, ce qui compte dans un job, c’est de vivre de véritables expériences, d’apprendre, de partager objectifs et résultats avec ses collègues. Bref, de tracer son propre chemin, différent, responsable et durable. Chez BNP Paribas, nous recrutons nos collaborateurs avec l’idée qu’ils nous aideront à concevoir le monde et la banque de demain.  Vous voulez connaître toutes les raisons de nous rejoindre ? Rendez-vous sur https://group.bnpparibas   Et la rémunération ?   Elle est fixée par Business France et consultable directement sur leur site.   Etes-vous notre prochain VIE Assistant Relationship Manager à Vietnam ?    A vous de nous convaincre !   Vous êtes titulaire d’un Master avec spécialisation en Management ou Gestion d'entreprise, Finance et/ou de projet et vous justifiez d’une expérience de 6 mois minimum (stage et alternance inclus) sur un poste similaire.  Vous parlez couramment anglais. Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le Pack Office (Excel).  Dans un monde qui change, la diversité, l’équité et l’inclusion sont des valeurs clés pour le bien-être et la performance des équipes. Chez BNP Paribas, nous souhaitons accueillir et retenir tous les talents sans distinction : c’est ainsi que nous construirons, ensemble, la finance de demain, innovante, responsable et durable.  Enfin, nous attachons une importance particulière à ce que nos futurs collaborateurs agissent au quotidien avec responsabilité éthique et professionnelle.  A tout moment pendant le processus de recrutement, les informations figurant sur votre CV, vos données d’identification et vos antécédents pourront être vérifiées.   Durée et disponibilité   Ce poste est à pourvoir dès que possible pour une durée de 24 mois.   Avant de postuler, veillez à vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité pour cette destination :  Faire son V.I.E à Vietnam (businessfrance.fr)  et ajouter à votre espace candidat un CV en anglais.

Como  Área Profit & Asset Protection Manager  serás responsable de proteger los bienes de la compañía, las propiedades, el stock, equipo y costes, con el fin de minimizar las pérdidas y contribuir al beneficio de la misma, en todas las tiendas del JD Group correspondientes al Sur de la Península.   Las Principales Funciones Son      Control de pérdidas e investigación de las mismas, investigando las causas y proponiendo acciones correctoras.   Investigación de incidencias en las tiendas, asegurando el cumplimiento de los procedimientos internos.   Colaborar para asegurar el cumplimiento de los requerimientos legales y de Administración de Profit Protection.   Realización de reportes e informes y cumpliendo con las investigaciones en los tiempos establecidos.      ¿Qué requisitos buscamos?      Grado en Criminología, Derecho o similares.   Valorable formación específica en temas relacionados y experiencia previa en el sector Retail.   Al menos 2 años de experiencia desempeñando el rol.   Nivel de Inglés B2.   Disponibilidad para residir en Sevilla y viajar de manera continuada por el área.   Permiso de conducir.      ¿Qué ofrecemos?      Bonus anual según performance.   Flexibilidad horaria.   Retribución flexible (seguro médico, restaurante, transporte, guardería...).   Descuento de empleado/a.   Plan de desarrollo personalizado y carrera en un entorno internacional (JD Group).   Amplio catálogo formativo en hard y soft skills (idiomas, formación técnica…)      Sobre El Grupo   Desde la creación de JD Sports en 1981, nos hemos convertido en líderes mundiales en Sports, Street & Premium Fashion. Contamos con alrededor de 65.000 personas, superando las 3400 tiendas de diversas marcas en más de 30 países. Te damos la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera en este grupo internacional en constante crecimiento.  Desde JD Group ofrecemos un entorno basado en la cooperación y el respeto mutuo, con un fuerte compromiso por la diversidad y la igualdad de oportunidades. Todas las personas serán consideradas sin importar su identidad de género, orientación sexual, etnia, religión, edad o grado de discapacidad.  Nuestros procesos de selección están basados en el modelo de evaluación por competencias profesionales y valoramos la pasión, ganas de aprender y de crecer en un entorno internacional.

The EHS Specialist is responsible for developing, implementing, and managing environmental, health, and safety programs to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and promote a safe and healthy work environment. This role involves conducting risk assessments, training employees, and ensuring that all safety policies and procedures are followed.    Mission:   EHS Program Development:   Develop and implement comprehensive EHS programs and policies.  Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal environmental, health, and safety regulations.  Conduct regular reviews and updates of EHS policies and procedures.  Perform risk assessments to identify potential hazards and implement corrective actions.  Investigate accidents, incidents, and near misses, and develop preventive measures.   Training and Education:   Develop and deliver EHS training programs for employees at all levels.  Ensure employees are informed of and adhere to EHS policies and procedures.  Maintain training records and ensure compliance with training requirements.   Environmental Management:   Monitor and manage environmental compliance, including waste management, air quality, and water quality.  Ensure proper handling, storage, and disposal of hazardous materials.  Develop and implement sustainability initiatives to reduce the environmental impact.   Health and Safety Management:   Promote a culture of safety and health within the organization.  Manage occupational health programs, including hearing conservation and respiratory protection.    Qualification:     Bachelor’s degree in Environmental Science, Occupational Health and Safety, or a related field. Advanced degree or certifications in EHS are a plus.    1-3 years in an EHS role, preferably in manufacturing factory.   Strong knowledge of EHS regulations and standards.  Good communication skill in both English & Vietnamese.    Desired characteristics:    Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.  Ability to develop and deliver training programs.

Position Overview:       Work with the contracting, database, and product teams at EXO Japan to keep the internal database up to date and accurate. This includes entering and maintaining price data, seasonality and other important conditions, as well as scheduling details, and contact information for suppliers and partners throughout Japan.    The ideal candidate for this position is someone who is comfortable working independently in a timely manner when requests for database entry and corrections come in. An attention to detail is highly important as well, as updated data is crucial for the booking team to accurately quote trip prices to clients.    We are a multicultural team at EXO, but a working proficiency of English is required. Familiarity with Japanese language is also desired but not required.       Location: 16-18 Hai Ba Trung, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, HCMC       Responsibilities:    ·        Input and manage the contracts details from suppliers, including rates, dates, seasonality and other details and loading the details into the Tourplan system     ·        Summarizing information from the contract and create a memo/excel calculation. (For Japanese speakers, translating Japanese contracts into English will be required)    ·        Work closely with the contracting and product teams on requests for input of new suppliers and products    ·        Respond quickly to requests for new data entry or corrections.       Cross check within the Product team to ensure the uploaded database / information / rates are accurate    ·        Assist requests from other departments and create service lines in the Tourplan and update the contact details in the system         Qualifications:     ·        Bachelor’s Degree in Tourism or related field    ·        Good command of English and/ or Japanese     ·        Be accurate, detail oriented and responsible for work    ·        Possess good team work   ·       1-2 years of experience in the tourism industry is a plus   ·      Interest and/or experience in the travel industry   ·      Understanding of sustainability and responsible tourism is a plus.        Skills:    ·       Good computer literacy (MS Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Google Workspace)   ·       Data-entry skills is a plus   ·      Be able to suggest improved ways of working to positively impact people’s life and the environment.        Benefits:     ·       Work in a friendly working environment and good team building activities   ·       18 days of annual leave and can be carried to the next year   ·       Parking fee support   ·       Health insurance and accident insurance since signing the first labor contract   ·       Other benefits according to the festive seasons will be shared at the interview   ·       Flexible working style, can work from home or at the office   ·       Participate in all online training programs of the whole EXO Group   ·       Bonus payment in June and December up to the business performance of each year.        How to apply:   	As an equal opportunity employer, if you have a passion for travel, believe that travel can be a real force for good in the world, and have skills that can help us achieve our mission, we would love to hear from you. COMPANY OVERVIEW       Fuse is an insurtech platform that connects various insurance products from many insurance companies with multiple distribution means, channels, or partners. We deploy the latest cutting edge technology to make insurance easy and affordable for anyone. Our platform supports primarily 3 business models, namely Business-To-Agents/Brokers (B2A), Business-To-Customers (B2C), as well as Micro Insurance (B2B2C)./   /   Fuse là nền tảng Insurtech kết nối các sản phẩm bảo hiểm khác nhau từ nhiều công ty bảo hiểm với nhiều phương tiện, kênh hoặc đối tác phân phối. Chúng tôi triển khai công nghệ tiên tiến mới nhất để giúp bảo hiểm trở nên dễ dàng và giá cả phải chăng cho mọi người. Nền tảng của chúng tôi chủ yếu hỗ trợ 3 mô hình kinh doanh, đó là Doanh nghiệp với đại lý/Nhà môi giới (B2A), Doanh nghiệp với khách hàng (B2C), cũng như Bảo hiểm vi mô (B2B2C).    Our Fuse Pro App is tailor-made for B2A business. This App enables anyone to become an independent insurance consultant to act like an expert; to instantly curate the most suitable and best insurance products for their customers. Our B2B2C model supports digital small ticket size insurance products, making insurance affordable for everyone./   Ứng dụng Fuse Pro của chúng tôi được thiết kế riêng cho doanh nghiệp B2A. Ứng dụng này cho phép mọi người trở thành nhà tư vấn bảo hiểm độc lập và hành động như một chuyên gia; để tuyển chọn ngay những sản phẩm bảo hiểm phù hợp và tốt nhất cho khách hàng. Mô hình B2B2C của chúng tôi hỗ trợ các sản phẩm bảo hiểm kỹ thuật số cỡ nhỏ, giúp bảo hiểm có giá cả phải chăng cho mọi người.    Fuse is a brand trusted by channel partners like Tokopedia, Grab, 30+ insurance companies, along with 40,000+ registered partners. Fuse currently generates more than 2.5 million insurance policies each month./   Fuse là thương hiệu được các đối tác kênh như Tokopedia, Grab, hơn 30 công ty bảo hiểm tin cậy, cùng với hơn 40.000 đối tác đã đăng ký. Fuse hiện tạo ra hơn 2,5 triệu hợp đồng bảo hiểm mỗi tháng.    We have more than 400 teammates, with 15 branches, across 4 countries, we strive to be the #1 insurtech platform in SEA and make insurance available for everyone in the region./   Chúng tôi có hơn 400 đồng đội, với 15 chi nhánh, trên 4 quốc gia, chúng tôi cố gắng trở thành nền tảng Insurtech số 1 tại Đông Nam Á và cung cấp bảo hiểm cho mọi người trong khu vực. Strong communication skills, especially in handling situations and working with customers.   /   Kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt, đặc biệt trong việc xử lý tình huống và làm việc với khách hàng. Proficiency in office software and the company's data management systems.   /   Sử dụng thành thạo các phần mềm văn phòng và hệ thống quản lý dữ liệu của công ty. Archetype Group    is a leading international construction consultancy company, we are shaping buildings that last with a full range of consulting services: Architecture & Master Planning, Building Engineering, Industrial & Process Engineering, Project & Cost Management. Since 2002, Archetype Group has been working on over 1,500 projects in 50 different countries across 4 continents.       We are seeking a    Site Engineer (C&S)    to manage and support site operations for our ongoing project in Binh Duong. The ideal candidate should have a background in civil engineering with relevant experience, particularly in working with contractors, investors, and consultancy firms. Strong communication skills in both Vietnamese and English, flexibility, and a willingness to relocate to the company’s project site are essential.       Qualifications   - Degree qualified in engineering or equivalent work experience  - 1-3+ years’ experience in construction/site environment. Experience includes works either under a main contractor and/or consultancy firms.  - Have experience managing multicultural project teams in an expatriate environment either in Asia, the Middle East, Africa or South America  - Basic working knowledge of software Excel, Word, AutoCAD. Knowledge of Microsoft project software is an advantage but not a requirement.  - Basic English written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to collate materials into a template report.  - Intermediate time management skills with the ability to work under pressure and to tight timeframes on occasion.  - Team player and able to adapt to changes within the construction process  - Fluency in written and spoken English is preferred.      Responsibilities   - Review and comment on drawing specifications and any other documents that may required for the project.  - Review and inspect the contractor capability in term of personel, equipment and other conditions with regard to the contract/bid conditions and legal requirements  - Where applicable provide suggestions or observations in respect to the element of the works.  - Carry out inspections based upon site specific requirements as directed by the line manager or QA/QC process.  - Assist with the development of the inspection process for the C&S/Finishing works at site.  - Record accurate inspections carried out in line with the site documents.  - Advise line manager and record where applicable any works not carried out in accordance with the drawings and specifications,  - Check the work done by the contractor.  - Assist with the H&S at site and advise line manager of any infringements.  - Assist where required in the development of the commissioning procedures that are required for the project.  - Review and comment in respect to As Built Drawings, and operations manuals.  - Provide support for the functional area of the project within which they are allocated, or for the project team as a whole, as required by the structure of the project team.  - Monitor and advise line manager of all of the works within their specific area of concern.  - Any other duties that may be assigned as part of the construction works.     🌟 𝑾𝒉𝒚 𝑱𝒐𝒊𝒏 𝑨𝒓𝒄𝒉𝒆𝒕𝒚𝒑𝒆?  👉 Work on groundbreaking projects  👉 Sharpen your skills and grow professionally  👉 Additional health care insurance and annual health check  👉 Annual performance review  👉 Flexible working hours and environment  👉 Team building activities and sports clubs  👉 Be part of an awesome, fun, and dynamic team!
